title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about creating user-friendly digital solutions that support learning and growth? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where your ideas truly matter?
 



  





 At PING PONG, we are currently looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer to join our dedicated team focused on supporting the public and corporate sectors. You’ll play a central role in developing and maintaining educational technology solutions used by regions, authorities, and businesses across Sweden.
 



  





 Our mission is to make learning easy, engaging, and lifelong – and we believe learning should be at the heart of every organization. As part of staying at the forefront of technology, we are exploring how AI can enhance our platform. To build our knowledge we have an AI hour where we explore, discuss and learn more about new technologies including AI.
 



  





 With over 2.4 million accounts and 300,000 monthly users, PING PONG is one of Sweden’s leading learning platform providers. We are proud to be making a tangible impact on education every day.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 




 As a Senior Fullstack Developer at PING PONG, you will be a key player in our mission to make learning simple, enjoyable, and lifelong. You will also help shape the digital hub for organizational learning.
 



  





 We work in a flat and agile organization, where quick decisions can be made, and where close collaboration is the norm. Our team culture is supportive, friendly, and open, we believe that great things happen when people feel comfortable and empowered.
 



  





 At Ping Pong, we offer an environment that supports your personal and professional growth. We give you the challenges and freedom to expand your skill set through tech talks, conferences, training, and more.
 



  





**In this role, you will also:** 



* Participate in the entire development cycle – from design and implementation to testing, deployment, and support of both new and existing features.
* Write testable, maintainable, and high-quality code, and take operational responsibility for the components you develop.
* Make thoughtful design and code decisions with a strong focus on the user experience.
* Contribute to product design and architectural planning for larger systems and features.
* Actively participate in product decisions and team processes.
* Work in an Agile environment using Scrum/Kanban as the development methodology.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 To succeed in this role, you have solid experience in software development and a strong attention to detail. We believe you’ll be a great fit if you value having fun at work, maintain a positive mindset, and have a genuine passion for learning new things. Most importantly, you enjoy collaborating closely with your team to create meaningful impact – together.
 



  





**We see that you:** 



* At least 6+ years of experience in professional Java development.
* Experience in web development with JavaScript, Vue, React, Angular, GraphQL, JSP.
* Solid understanding of database systems and design (PostgreSQL).
* You are a team player who appreciates the value of working together (pair/mob programming) but can also work independently.
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills in English.



  





**About Ping Pong** 




 We’ve been developing digital learning tools since 1996 and continue to evolve and grow by building new features and products that meet the needs of modern education. Our office is located in beautiful surroundings in Stockholm, overlooking Södermalm, and we are a close-knit team of around 20 dedicated colleagues. We value curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning, and we believe in having fun while doing meaningful work.
 



  





 Ping Pong AB has partnered exclusively with Safemind for this recruitment process.

title: Game Developer
description:
**About the Internship** 




  






 Are you passionate about game development and excited to contribute to a next-gen, AI-powered shooter game?
 





 Realdini Studios is looking for Game Developer Interns who are eager to gain hands-on experience using Unreal Engine 5 and want to play a role in shaping a visually stunning and narratively rich multiplayer game. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your skills, collaborate with a creative team, and build your portfolio with real-world development experience.
 




  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Work directly in Unreal Engine 5 to develop core gameplay mechanics, multiplayer systems, and AI integrations.
* Collaborate with artists, designers, and AI specialists to bring game features to life.
* Use GitHub for version control and team-based collaboration.
* Optimize game systems for performance and player experience.
* Participate in regular brainstorming and sprint meetings to help shape the game's direction.



  





**Must-Have Skills** 



* Knowledge of Unreal Engine 5 and Blueprint scripting.
* Familiarity with interfaces and how to implement them within game systems.
* Basic understanding of game mechanics, physics, and AI behaviors.
* A strong desire to learn and contribute to real-world game development projects.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a creative and dynamic team.
* Familiarity with GitHub and version control best practices.



  





**Nice-to-Haves** 



* Experience integrating AI or procedural storytelling features.
* Exposure to multiplayer networking and replication in UE5.
* Background in game design, UI, or VFX.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A chance to work on a ground breaking multiplayer shooter game from the early stages.
* Portfolio-building opportunities with real contributions to a functioning game project.
* A flexible, remote-friendly internship built around your availability.
* Mentorship and collaboration with game artists, developers, and designers.
* Workshops to help you grow and improve your technical and creative skills.
* A Certificate of Completion and professional reference upon successful participation.



  





**Important Note** 




**🚨 This is an unpaid internship focused on skill enhancement, professional growth, and portfolio development at an early-stage startup** 

 . Please only apply if you're comfortable with this arrangement.
 





 Ready to code the future of gaming with us? Apply now and help shape something truly innovative.

title: Mobile Software Developer
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**More independence, freedom, and better pay**
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**This is Coody**
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Mobile Developer Consultant at Coody, you’ll dive into technically challenging and engaging assignments that help companies level up their teams and projects. You’ll be crafting high-quality, efficient, and maintainable code using native or hybrid platforms (such as Android, iOS, React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform or Flutter). You will collaborate close with other engineers, designers, product people and other teams to build mobile experiences for some of the most exciting brands within tech.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. New challenges? Bring them on. We see them as opportunities for growth. Typically, you’ll take on 1-2 different assignments per year. Are you ready to make a difference?
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for a Mobile Developer with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a doer’s mindset. Here’s what we’re after:
   

  

* Strong expertise in either Swift, Kotlin, Flutter or React Native
* Unit testing experience and a solid understanding of the release cycle, and CI/CD
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


**How To Apply**
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criteria? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Senior Software Engineer
job_function: Information Technology, Engineering, and Product Management
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
**Java Developer | Stockholm | End-User | Medical Sector** 




  





 An innovative end-user company within the medical technology sector is currently looking for a Java Developer to join their in-house engineering team in Stockholm.
 



  





 The company is looking for a developer who can take an active role in building and maintaining backend services that power critical medical applications. You will work in a cloud-native environment, leveraging AWS services to deliver robust solutions for healthcare professionals and patients.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and maintain backend systems using Java 21+ and Spring Boot.
* Design and implement APIs to integrate with medical systems and devices.
* Work within an AWS environment, utilizing services such as Lambda, RDS, S3, and ECS.
* Build and optimize containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes.
* Contribute to CI/CD processes, automated testing, and code reviews.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, QA, and cloud teams to deliver high-quality software.



  





**Key Requirements:** 



* Strong background in backend development with Java (ideally Java 17+ or 21+).
* Experience working with AWS cloud services.
* Solid understanding of Spring Boot and RESTful API development.
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
* Commitment to clean code, testing, and modern development practices.
* Passion for solving complex problems that have a real-world impact



  





 This is a chance to be part of a company where your work will have a direct and lasting impact on healthcare and patient wellbeing. You’ll be joining a stable, product-focused environment that values modern technology, clean code, and strong engineering practices. The company offers a permanent position with competitive benefits, a collaborative and purpose-driven culture, and a flexible hybrid work setup, allowing you to split your time between their Stockholm office and remote work.
 



  





 Apply above!

title: Procurement Developer & Analyst
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

 Are you passionate about building strong teams and ensuring compliance in a complex international landscape? H&M Group is looking for a Regional Hub Manager to lead our Finance & Accounting operations across Northern and Central Europe, including some of our oldest and most mature markets.
   

  

**Job Description**
**WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US**
 Are you ready to help shape the future of procurement and drive cost efficiencies across our organisation? Join us as a Procurement developer & analyst and play a crucial role in enhancing our capabilities in procuring indirect products and services across our diverse portfolio of brands and functions.
   

  

 Group Indirect Procurement is a newly established team within H&M Group CFO Office. Purpose with the team is to achieve cost efficiencies, capture procurement synergies and reduce supplier risks within indirect goods and services across brands and functions within the Group.
   

  

 We are currently developing our centre of excellence for indirect procurement and will be implementing a new operating model together with a Source-to-Pay (S2P) solution.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Procurement developer & analyst to play a crucial role in supporting our procurement organisation and its end-users. This position combines technical system administration with process understanding, focusing on ensuring our procurement systems are accessible, efficient, and compliant. You will be a key point of contact for system support, Business tech, managing configurations, and troubleshooting issues to maintain high productivity across the business.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

* Serve as a point of contact for support of the procurement organisation, business tech, and the company's end users.
* Administration and control of system user access.
* Lead configuration change settings.
* Point of Contact for system provider to address tickets etc.
* Supports configuration work and documentation of changes made.
* Maintaining configuration settings in the future Source-to-Pay solution.
* Provide technical support for business-critical applications and systems.
* Manage user accounts, permissions, and group policies to support business roles.
* Monitor and maintain system health to ensure uninterrupted operations.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues affecting productivity (e.g., login failures, application errors, printing issues).
* Collaborate with business units to understand system usage needs and support optimisation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational policies, data protection, and audit requirements.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Apart from frequently connecting with colleagues across Functions and Brands, you will belong to the Indirect Procurement team, consisting of dedicated, brave and supporting senior procurement professionals with extensive experience from procurement in various industries and cost categories. As the team is quite newly established, the spirit of being part of shaping the future and doing it together is strong.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
 You have experience from managing and developing Source-to-Pay solutions to enable procurement operating models. You are business-focused and have a result-driven mindset understanding how the Source-to-Pay solutions can enable people and the business. You are experienced in driving and creating long-term change by “making it stick”. You also have strong willingness and courage to break new grounds, and ability to get people engaged and willing to embrace new way of working.
   

  

 Additionally, we see that you have:
   

  

* University degree in Business Administration, Industrial Engineering & Management or equivalent.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a service-oriented mindset.
* Basic scripting and configuration skills to streamline routine tasks.
* Ability to prioritize support tickets and communicate effectively with non-technical users.
* Understanding of business workflows and how systems support them.
* Preferably experience of data modelling and BI-tools (Microsoft PowerBI, QlikSence, QlikView, Tableau, or other relevant system).
* Experience from Category Management and Procurement of indirect Goods and Services in a large enterprise environment.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills and evidence of concise, structured, thought-through communication.


**Additional Information**
**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: AI Full-Stack Engineer / Developer (m/f/d)
description:
Xylem is a Fortune 500 global water solutions company dedicated to advancing sustainable impact and empowering the people who make water work every day. As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
   

  

 We’re seeking an experienced
 **AI Full-Stack Engineer / Developer (m/f/d)** 
 responsible for developing and implementing end-to-end solutions that incorporate artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities while maintaining expertise in both front-end and back-end development.
   

  

 This AI Engineer / Developer (m/f/d) plays a key role in developing and deploying AI-driven applications by working across the entire technology stack—both frontend and backend—while integrating machine learning models into production systems.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between AI research and real-world applications by integrating AI models into scalable, user-friendly software solutions.
   

  

 Location: Schaffhausen in Switzerland (Xylem Europe Headquarter) or Sundbyberg in Sweden.
   

  

**Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities**
**AI/ML Development**
* Design and implement machine learning models and algorithms (e.g., NLP, computer vision, recommendation systems)
* Deploying AI models into applications using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch or Scikit-Learn.
* Optimizing models for performance, scalability, and efficiency
* Develop and maintain AI-powered features and functionalities
* Optimize ML models for production environments
* Integrate AI services and APIs into existing applications


**Full-Stack Development**
* Building and managing APIs to serve AI models (e.g., Flask, FastAPI, or Django).
* Handling data processing pipelines and integrating AI models with databases and cloud services
* Ensuring security, authentication, and access control for AI services
* Enhancing UX/UI by leveraging AI capabilities (e.g., personalized recommendations, intelligent automation).
* Deploying AI models to production environments (cloud/on-premise) using Docker, Kubernetes, or serverless computing
* Automating CI/CD pipelines for AI applications
* Familiarity with deep learning architectures
* Develop RESTful APIs and microservices
* Implement database solutions and data pipelines
* Ensure cross-platform compatibility and responsive design
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code


**Performance, Optimization and Scaling**
* Ensuring AI applications are scalable and performant under different workloads
* Optimizing API response times and reducing computational costs
* Implementing caching strategies, parallel processing, and distributed computing


**Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certification:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* Additional certifications in AI/ML or product management (preferred)
* 5+ years of full-stack development experience
* 3+ years of experience with AI/ML technologies
* Programming – Python, JavaScript (Node.js), Java, or Go
* AI/ML Frameworks – TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenCV, Hugging Face
* Backend – Flask, FastAPI, Django, Node.js
* Frontend – React, Angular, Vue.js
* Databases – PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis
* Cloud & DevOps – AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
* MLOps – Model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management
* Proven track record of successful AI project implementations
* Excellent communication skills
* Team collaboration
* Project management capabilities
* Ability to work in fast-paced environments


**We Offer You More Than Just “A Job”**
* Professional Development – To advance the capabilities of our people, we offer a wide variety of experiences to support our employees’ professional growth and continuous learning.
* Total Rewards – We offer comprehensive programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, work-life integration and corporate citizenship.
* Watermark – Watermark is our corporate social responsibility program working to provide education and access to safe water to ensure healthy lives, gender equality, and resilient communities. Employees can learn and volunteer on various water-related projects.
* Employee Networks – Our Employee Networks provide a professional, supportive network for employees from diverse backgrounds, including Women’s, LGBT+ and Allies, Veteran’s, People of Color and Allies, Emerging Leaders, and Working Parents Networks.


 For questions regarding this opportunity, please reach out to Niklas Naunheim, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner at +49 1621374371.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 Xylem is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of inclusion and belonging in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
company_industry: Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing and Defense and Space Manufacturing
description:
Coalesce Management Consultancy (CMC) have a consulting assignment available for an Embedded software engineer to work on a project we have in Stockholm.
 



  





  





 CMC provide expert engineering solutions on an international capacity for Embedded Systems, Electronics, Hardware and other Advanced Engineering projects. Established in 2016, we set out our mission to be the best service-driven consulting business in global STEM markets, and after rapid growth in just a few years, we’re already delivering true expertise to major technology brands and leading companies around the world.
 



  





  





 As we expand our reach and take on new projects, we have assignments available for experienced technology professionals to join our consultancy and deliver the expert solutions and high level of service we’re known for across multiple ventures.
 



  





  





 By partnering with CMC, you get the chance to work with some of the world’s leading technology specialists. From our global offices we support you with each new project, providing a complete scope of work definition ahead of any engagement so you know exactly what’s required by the assignment, before you land on-site. As the project is completed, we can continue to work with you by setting up your next project from our global network of leading technology companies.
 



  





  






 Join our latest project
 




  





  





 Currently, we’re looking for an experienced low level Embedded software developer to help us provide solutions on a project based in Stockholm.
 



  





  





 You’ll be involved in:
 


* Working and developing with driven colleagues, sharing knowledge
* Debug, validate, and support
 **real-time multiprocessor** 
 applications
* Develop and maintain high-quality software for
 **embedded systems** 
 in an agile R&D environment
* Close customer contact with the team's customers, which means a varied role for those of you who love to develop



  





  





 In order to suit the project requirements, you must have:

 If you have the relevant capability and are interested in pursuing this assignment, talk to our sales consultants today. alex.hope@cmcexpertisedelivered.com
 



  





  






 Get in touch
 




  





  





 Learn more about Coalesce Management Consulting, our projects and the support we provide to our consultants at https://www.expertisedelivered.com
 



  





  





 No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

title: OAuth -utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som OAuth -utvecklare**
 Du kommer att arbeta i vårt team på Skandia som arbetar med OAuth och relaterade protokoll såsom OpenID Connect. Teamet består av fyra personer; utvecklare, teknikspecialister och Scrum Master. Vårt uppdrag är att designa och implementera säkerhetsmekanismer som skyddar Skandias affärskritiska bank- och försäkringstjänster. Vi äger hela livscykeln för vårt OAuth 2.0- och OpenID Connect-tjänster: från teknisk design via DevSecOps-flöde till förvaltning i produktion. Rollen innebär att du har nära samarbete med både infrastruktursidan och webbutvecklingssidan.
   

  

**Några Av De Vanligaste Arbetsuppgifterna Kommer Vara**
* Design, implementering och hanterar OAuth och relaterade protokoll (som OpenID Connect) för säker autentisering och auktorisering för webb- eller mobilapplikationer.
* Säkerställa skalbarhet, tillförlitlighet och säkerhet för dessa implementationer.
* Teknisk support och felsökning av problem relaterade till OAuth-implementeringar.
* Skapa dokumentation och utbildningsmaterial för utvecklare om hur OAuth ska implementeras på ett säkert sätt.
* Stödja utvecklingsteamen med teknisk design och granskning av lösningar.


 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till närmaste chef inom IT gemensamt.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du nyfiken att lära dig mer om inloggning och säkerhetssystem, driver dina egna saker från start till mål, arbetar ordningsamt och noggrant i ditt dagliga arbete. Du är kommunikativ mot andra intressenter internt och externt och kan analysera mycket data utifrån olika perspektiv.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen har du mångårig erfarenhet av.NET utveckling där du skaffat dig en djup förståelse för ramverket och dess ekosystem. Du har arbetat tidigare med OAuth-flöden, token-hantering och tillhörande säkerhetsrutiner. Din vardag har inkluderat API-integrationer, CI/CD-pipelines och automatiserade tester där du känner dig hemma i frågor som rör kryptering samt nyckel- och certifikathantering. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du arbetat med Ansible, i Windows- eller Linuxmiljö och Containers.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Lena Nilsson Bäckman på Lena.NilssonBaeckman@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

*Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka* 
 .
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: ServiceNow utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som ServiceNow utvecklare**
 Som ServiceNow utvecklare blir du en viktig del av vårt ServiceNow & Configuration team i Stockholm bestående av utvecklare, lösningsarkitekt och processpecialister. Teamets huvuduppdrag är att kvalitetssäkra ett driftstabilt Skandia. Du arbetar nära verksamheten för att förstå deras krav, ta fram lösnings- och designförslag utifrån ServiceNows best practices och säkerställa en smidig implementation tillsammans med teamet. I rollen är du även delaktig i att utveckla och förvalta plattformen, förstå licensmodellen och bidra till att ServiceNow utvecklas på bästa sätt över tid.
   

  

 Eftersom teamet är litet kommer du även periodvis involveras i felsökning, hantera inkommande incidenter och arbeta med löpande förvaltningsarbete. Rollen innebär att du får möjlighet att arbeta med olika delar på Skandia från IT och säkerhet till HR, juridik och inköp vilket gör att du breddar din kompetens och påverkan på plattformens framtid.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT process & leveransstöd.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi söker dig som har mångårig arbetserfarenhet inom ServiceNow utveckling och förvaltning av plattformen. Du har jobbat med ITSM, CMDB, Discovery samt dagligen designat och underhållit API-integrationer. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, i tal såväl som skrift. Meriterande är om du har kunskap om ITIL och SAFe.
   

  

 Som person är du målmedveten, engagerad och noggrann. Du är kommunikativ och kan samarbeta med andra personer både självständigt eller i grupp.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Monica Eriksson på monica.eriksson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

*Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Global Packaging Developer, Packaging Assortment & Selection
description:
*Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.*
**Role Summary**
 As part of the global packaging team, you will have the possibility to shape the future of packaging within Scania and the TRATON Group. We are in the beginning of a major transformation; all intercontinental flows will be converted into one-way packaging instead of using returnable. As Global Packaging Developer, you will have an essential role, leading the development and implementation of new special packaging in one-way materials. This will be accomplished together with procurement, packaging suppliers, the colleague at the local production units as well as with concerned part suppliers.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As Global Packaging Developer, your role and scope may vary over time according to the needs of the project and the Global Packaging Assortment team, but main responsibilities are:
   

  

  

* Initiate, lead and participate in assignments and projects connected to Scania’s and the TRATON Group packaging assortment. From idea, through development, testing and implementation in our industrial network
* Assure continuous improvement and to drive change in the packaging area towards more sustainable and cost-efficient solutions
* Keep up to date with the current trends and future development of packaging solutions for the automotive industry
* Highlight and define demands on packaging material through close collaboration with stakeholders within the supply chain to ensure development of packaging solutions designed for our processes and production
* Be responsible of keeping related standards and processes updated. Actively challenge them to find efficiency and eliminate waste within the supply chain based on a holistic view of cost, sustainability and quality
* Represent Scania externally in packaging development through collaboration with packaging manufacturers, logistic service providers and part suppliers
* Participate in cross functional development forums together with Packaging stakeholders within Scania and the TRATON Group.


**Who You Are**
 You are a positive, structured and ambitious individual with good communication and relation-building skills. Your data-driven mindset and can do-attitude, will enable you to collaborate effectively with different stakeholders for a positive outcome. Furthermore, you share knowledge and have the ability to positively influence others.
   

  

 We also believe that you:
   

  

  

* You have a University degree (or comparable), preferably within Mechanical Engineering or Logistics, and a minimum of 8-10 years working experience. Previous experience in project management within packaging development and/or supply chain development is an advantage
* To be successful in the role, you easily see the big picture, understand the details and see new opportunities. You are ambitious, determined and have a hands on-attitude that makes us reach our goals and commitments.
* Are enthusiastic and like to work in a fast-changing environment, you see challenges as opportunities
* You are well structured, process oriented and skilled within Excel, Power BI or similar analytics tool and base your solutions on facts, data and analytics.
* Are comfortable building and maintaining relationships, both within and outside the organization
* Are fluent in English, both written and spoken. Swedish is an advantage. If this job description matches your profile, we look forward to your application!


**This Is Us**
 OA – Packaging is responsible for shaping Scania's global packaging strategy. Our ambition is to lead in sustainable logistics, optimizing our logistics flows from a packaging perspective. We strive to ensure minimal environmental impact, high quality, and minimal total logistics costs in our supply chain. As part of the TRATON Group, we collaborate closely with other brands to maximize our collective potential.
   

  

 The Packaging Assortment & Selection team (OAPB) is responsible for the development and maintenance of the Scania standard packaging assortment to assure that the company is ready for upcoming demands. We have high ambition to improve the assortment by streamlining it and focus on the right material choices to decrease our ecological footprint. We are also responsible for central selection process which aims to standardize and align the way of working within the production units in the global Scania network as well as within the TRATON Group.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**Please note that during week 29-32 the recruitmentprocess will pause due to vacation.**
 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Sofia Nilsson, Manager Packaging Assortment & Selection, sofia.x.scania@scania.com.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Hi,
   

  

 emagine is looking for a skilled Infrastructure / Platform / Cloud Native contractor to join the Infra PA in Core Infra studio through the end of the year. The contractor will support squads affected by internal reshuffling as we create growth opportunities for senior ICs to lead beyond their squads. The contractor will help maintain high standards of reliability, scalability, and automation across our systems.
   

  

 We’re prioritizing Stockholm-based candidates due to strong co-location with 4 of 6 squads in Infra PA, but are open to highly experienced EU-based engineers with excellent remote collaboration skills.
   

  

 The Opportunity
   

  

 Client's Platform Mission creates the technology that enables the company to scale globally, experiment rapidly, and build for a billion users. From frameworks to infrastructure, we amplify innovation, productivity, and quality across all engineering teams.
   

  

 You’ll join the Core Infrastructure group within the Infra Product Area, responsible for the cloud-native backbone powering the client's entire backend. We provide services for container orchestration, observability, reliability, cloud resource and storage management, production networking, and service discovery at multi-million core scale. The work is technical, impactful, and core to how all developers deliver features globally.
   

  

 What we are looking for
   

  

* 5+ years experience in Infrastructure or Platform Engineering roles
* Experienced backend developer with solid programming/scripting skills (Java, Go, Python, Bash)
* Comfortable with building and operating production infrastructure in a cloud-native environment (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
* Strong experience in Kubernetes and distributed system design at scale
* Strong automation and IaC experience (Terraform, Helm, CI/CD pipelines)
* Deep understanding of reliability engineering, performance tuning, and incident response


 Job Posting Start Date: 2025-07-21
   

  

 Job Posting End Date: 2025-12-31
   

  

 Location: Remote

title: BI Developer and Project Manager
description:
The People mission at Investor is to enable value creation by creating a sustainable, inclusive and attractive work experience where people can have positive impact and reach their full potential.
 



  





 We are now looking for a new
 *BI Developer and Project Manager* 
 in our IT team.
 



 As part of the team, you will advance the data and analytics agenda at Investor while also programming and developing. Your role includes both operational and strategic tasks, working individually and with colleagues across Investor.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 




 Design and develop BI solutions that support business decisions. Model data to ensure efficient and accurate data management. Develop and maintain both frontend and backend components of BI systems ensuring a holistic view ad usage of the platform. Implement and follow agile methods, including serving as project manager when needed.
 



  





**Skills and experience** 




**Data Modelling** 
 : Demonstrated experience in creating and managing data models, including ER diagrams and dimensional models, following BI best practices and patterns like star schema.
 



**Frontend Development:** 
 Expertise in tools such as Power BI for designing insightful data visualizations and ensuring user experience and security in Power BI services.
 



**Backend Development:** 
 Experience with SQL Server, a strong understanding of ETL processes, and familiarity with tools such as Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL
 



**Agile Methods:** 
 Experience in agile methods and improvement of workflows, including leading sprint activities and projects.
 



**Analytical Skills:** 
 Strong analytical skills for translating business needs into data-driven solutions.
 



  





  





**To be successful in the role, we believe you:** 



* are a value-driven team player, with high integrity and strong interpersonal skills
* enjoy leading other people and thrive in
 **cross-functional teams**
* bring strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, and work in a structured and self-motivated manner
* have strong communication skills, verbally as well as in writing



  





 Further qualifications include a bachelor’s degree in data science, or other academic degree and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience of development and project management.
 



 The
 *BI developer and Project Manager* 
 role reports to the Head of IT.
 



  





 For this recruitment, we are partnering with Novare Tech. Applications are welcome until the 31st of August, while interviews are planned to begin in mid-August.
 



  





 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact the responsible recruiter, Mitra Frost, or researcher, Anna Jansson, at Novare Tech.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
```html
 



**About the Company** 




  





  





 As we continue to enhance and scale our growing platform, we're looking for a motivated DevOps Engineer with strong hands-on and design skills to join our IT team. This role will focus primarily on supporting and evolving our native iOS and Android pipelines and infrastructure as well as on premise and AWS cloud. The DevOps engineer should be able to diagnose and resolve problems reliably, lead continuous improvement culture, and have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary stakeholders. Initiative, resourcefulness, and autonomy are key attributes for success. You will be comfortable diagnosing and resolving complex issues, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, and communicating effectively with a wide range of interdisciplinary stakeholders. We're looking for someone who is proactive, able to quickly understand and integrate complex systems, juggle multiple priorities, and think creatively to design simple, robust solutions to challenging problems. You know the software development lifecycle better than the back of your hand, and you’re fully comfortable working in Agile environments.
 



  





  





 Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 As we continue to enhance and scale our growing platform, we're looking for a motivated DevOps Engineer with strong hands-on and design skills to join our IT team. This role will focus primarily on supporting and evolving our native iOS and Android pipelines and infrastructure as well as on premise and AWS cloud. The DevOps engineer should be able to diagnose and resolve problems reliably, lead continuous improvement culture, and have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary stakeholders. Initiative, resourcefulness, and autonomy are key attributes for success. You will be comfortable diagnosing and resolving complex issues, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, and communicating effectively with a wide range of interdisciplinary stakeholders. We're looking for someone who is proactive, able to quickly understand and integrate complex systems, juggle multiple priorities, and think creatively to design simple, robust solutions to challenging problems. You know the software development lifecycle better than the back of your hand, and you're fully comfortable working in Agile environments.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Ownership of the CI/CD pipeline ensuring a stable and performant platform/process.
* Effective communication with Operation's and Development teams.
* Continuously improve processes and documentation.
* Effective resolution of assigned tickets and tasks.
* Documentation and Knowledge sharing.
* Provide end to end solutions including its execution.
* Provide user support to engineering teams.
* Set up tools and required infrastructure.
* Encourage and build automated processes wherever possible.
* Incident management and root cause analysis.
* Follow the company processes, procedures, and methodologies.
* Collaborate to achieve common goals.
* Support and act in line with the company values.
* Keep up to date with compliance training offered by the company.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  









**Qualifications** 




  





  





 Strong experience designing CI/CD pipelines tailored to developer needs.
 



  





  





**Required Skills** 




  





  




* Proficient in scripting and automation using Ansible, Python, and Bash.
* Hands-on experience containerizing applications using Docker and orchestrating them with Kubernetes or Docker Swarm.
* Familiarity with tools like Vault, Artifactory, and ArgoCD for secure secrets management and artifact delivery.
* Proficient in Git and Bitbucket for source control management.
* Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools, especially Terraform.
* Exposure to monitoring and observability tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and Kibana.
* Familiar with a range of infrastructure technologies: Couchbase, Elasticsearch, Oracle, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, and Kafka.
* Experience with virtualization platforms like Hyper-V, OpenStack, VMware, and RHVE.
* Experience deploying and operating systems in Azure, AWS, and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).



  









**Preferred Skills** 




  





  




* Experience managing CI/CD pipelines for Android and iOS native apps using Jenkins or GitLab CI.
* Familiarity with Fastlane for automating mobile build, signing, testing, and deployment.
* Understanding of Gradle (Android) and Xcodebuild/xcodeproj/Swift (iOS).
* Knowledge of Apple Developer certificates, provisioning profiles, and keychains for code signing.
* Experience with keystore management for Android (.keystore/.jks).
* Familiarity with app packaging and versioning (.apk, .aab, .ipa).
* Experience with testing tools like TestFlight, XCTest, Appium, or similar.
* Knowledge of static code analysis tools such as SonarQube, SwiftLint, and Android Lint.
* Experience managing macOS build systems, including Homebrew, Xcode CLI tools, Android SDK/NDK, and setting up Jenkins agents or GitLab runners.
* Familiarity with running iOS simulators and Android emulators via CLI in CI environments.



  









**Pay range and compensation package** 




  





  





 Occasional out of hour's conferencing with overseas colleagues. Occasional out of hours or weekend work. A workplace that supports & role models Diversity & Inclusion. This is a huge part of who we are and what FDJ United stands for. Learning & Development to assist you to achieve your career goals. Fast-paced agile environment, with leading-edge technology and innovation. Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing.
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 




  





  





 Ability to cope up with competing demands and remain focused on competing priorities. Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with impact. Excellent time management and organisational skills. Can relate to employees at all levels of the organisation. Ability to gain co-operation and commitment. People focus.
 



  





 ```

title: Senior Data & AI Platform Engineer
description:
**From ideas to reality. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**About the role:**
 Because you’re not here to build just another data pipeline or just deploy another AI model—you’re here to help craft the
 **Global Data & AI Platform** 
 that empowers engineers across the world. Our mission? To make life delightful (= build and serve awesome DevEx) for:
   

  

* Data Engineers building scalable, high-quality pipelines
* Analytics Engineers transforming raw data into insights
* AI Engineers deploying models that do everything from predicting the future (= classic ML) to generating it (= GenAI and Agentic architectures)


 All while ensuring
 **Data Governance** 
 ,
 **Observability** 
 , and
 **Discoverability** 
 are baked into every bite.
   

  

 We’re the team that keeps the platform relevant, scalable, and ready for whatever wild new capability the future throws at us. If you like building tools that make other engineers high-five their screens, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As a Senior Data & AI Platform Engineer you will be building a world-class Data & AI platform that empowers developers (DevEx), delights stakeholders, and drives innovation across the organization. You’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our data infrastructure, AI capabilities, and engineering culture.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Champion Developer Experience Design and develop a developer-first platform that simplifies data ingestion & transformation, AI model deployment, and agentic architectures—enabling everything from insightful dashboards to advanced AI applications.
* Deliver High-Quality Code Write, test, and deploy robust, scalable, and production-ready features that ensure reliability and performance across our platform.
* Drive Strategy and Culture Co-own the roadmap and backlog for our Global Data & AI platform. Influence and shape the engineering culture across the organization through leadership and collaboration.
* Build Scalable Infrastructure Partner with cross-functional teams to evolve a platform that supports data pipelines, visualizations, model inference, and cutting-edge AI use cases.
* Explore and Innovate Stay ahead of the curve by identifying and integrating emerging technologies and capabilities that keep our platform future-ready.


**Who you are:**
* A B.Sc. in Computer Science—or equivalent skills and experiences.
* 3+ years of software engineering experience, with solid Python competence (extra points for Rye/UV/Poetry, Ruff, Typeddict etc.). Both for actual for the platform and to be able to dogfood our DevEx!
* 2+ years of SQL experience. Because someone’s gotta tame the data beast and dogfood our DevEx!
* 3+ years building scalable, cloud-native platforms with top-tier DevEx (bonus: for Data & AI related). Solid Terraform, IaC etc. Competence. Cloud ninja skills in AWS/GCP/Azure (extra points for Azure).
* A pragmatic mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to explain complex ideas to non-technical colleagues.
* A love for clean code, automated testing, version control, and shipping software that just works.
* Bonus points for Databricks experience (Pyspark, Delta, Unity Catalog—you know the drill).


**Where you’ll be** 
**:**
 This is a position based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 We are proud of our culture of inclusivity and diversity. At our Global Headquarters we have 60+ nationalities working together for our common goals. You will be part of this dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment;
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services;
* Insurance policy plan;
* Gym, sauna and massage
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**Ready to redefine the developer experience for Data, Analytics, and AI Engineering?** 
 Apply now and help us turn Electrolux into a Data & AI engineering powerhouse! As part of Electrolux Group, we are committed to continuously investing in your development, ensuring there are no barriers to where your career can take you.

title: Star Stable Labs Experimentation and Innovation Lead
description:
**About Star Stable Entertainment** 




 Once upon a time in 2011, the founders of Star Stable Entertainment had a vision. They wanted to create a game that could make a difference. Although half of gamers are girls and women, they were under-represented in the gaming industry, both as characters and creators. We dreamed of an epic online world where tween and teen girls could share an amazing experience. And we wanted to challenge how things were done in a male-dominated industry. Fast forward to today, and our dream has come true tenfold - Star Stable Online stands as one of the most popular MMORPGs globally! At our HQ on Södermalm, our 140 employees are thrilled to continue to welcome players to the island of Jorvik, with its breathtaking scenery, beautiful horses, and magical quests. It’s wonderful to see that our dream resonates with so many players around the world, and we can’t wait to share more stories and experiences with them!
 



  





**The position** 




 In order to keep up the pace and take innovation to the next level we're looking for a
 **dynamic and pragmatic leader** 
 to spearhead Star Stable Labs, our new game experience experiments team.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  





 This role demands a unique blend of creativity, organizational skills, and business acumen. We believe that you are:
 


* **Curious Visionary & Hands-On:** 
 You love to drive bold experimentation with a "go fast" mindset, balancing creative flair with a practical, results-driven approach.
* **Strategic Executor:** 
 You thrive when managing multiple parallel tests, and know when to pivot or move on. Killing darlings comes naturally to you.
* **Exceptional Communicator:** 
 You foster transparency, articulating exciting visions and easily convert experimental outcomes into clear player and business value, inspiring both the wider Star Stable team and leadership.
* **Empathetic & Firm Leader:** 
 You get energy from motivating, adapting, and keeping the Labs team happy and focused while navigating complexity and maintaining high standards.



  





  





**We think you** 




  





 We believe that previously in your career you have been and done the following:
 


* **Entrepreneurial Game Developer:** 
 You have extensive hands-on experience from startups or similar environments, demonstrating the ability to rapidly prototype and iterate with limited resources, while validating towards the target audience..
* **Proven Innovator & Shipper:** 
 You have a game director mindset with a track record of shipping new games or bringing innovative features to market/scaled development, ideally within live-ops and F2P/subscription models.
* **Creative Team Leader:** 
 You have led diverse, creative teams through the full development cycle, from ideation to delivery, with documented successful outcomes.



  





**Perks for joining us?** 



* A pretty sweet mission. We are developing the world's best horse-riding game for girls and we take that vision very seriously. We strive to hit that mark every single day.
* 30 vacation days (+ 3 additional squeeze days).
* A pension and insurance plan that mimics ITP1 and a parental pay top-up @90%.
* Private Healthcare insurance and free therapy through Euro Accident
* Health allowance at 5000 SEK per year.
* Hybrid working model - combine WFH and being together with the team at our new office located right amidst Södermalm GameDev cluster (Magnus Ladulåsgatan 65)
* Fitness discount of 18% at SATS gym + company workout classes.
* A dog room at the office! Bring your furry friend to work!



  





 Are you ready to be a chapter on this magical journey? Apply now! We can’t wait to hear your story!
 



  





*Due to Vacations the interviews will start in August.*

title: praktik frontend-utvecklare
description:
Vi hjälper våra kunder att lättare ta beslut genom att omvandla data till insikter. Vi utvecklar en molntjänst för intelligent inköpsanalys och vi kan även skräddarsy lösningar efter kundens behov.
 




  






 Vill du förbättra förutsättningarna för Sveriges alla inköpare och har en kommande praktikperiod?
 





 Vi på PRO(a)ACT har möjlighet att erbjuda praktik. Vi är under tillväxt och behöver stärka upp arbetet av vår webapplikation. Har du läst frontend, UX, webbutveckling och vill få inblick från att jobba på ett produkt/konsultbolag och vara med att bygga framtidens lösningar?
 




  






 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade medarbetare; vars dagliga arbete, åsikter och idéer inte bara spelar roll, utan de facto är helt och hållet avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt!
 




  





**Om praktiken** 





 Vi söker en driven student som vill göra sin LIA hos oss och utvecklas inom både frontend och backend – med särskilt fokus på användarupplevelse och gränssnittsdesign. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett litet men passionerat team där din insats gör skillnad.
 




  






 Du kommer att ha en viktig roll i vårt team att ta förbättra användarupplevelsen i webappen. Tillsammans med teamet genomför du olika aktiviteter som syftar till att stärka vårt varumärke och öka kundtillväxten.
 




  






 Du har möjlighet att delta i hela utvecklingsprocessen – från idé till färdig produkt.
 




  





**Vem är du?** 





 Vi söker dig som läser relevant YH-utbildning inom webbutveckling, UX eller liknande
 



* Kunnig inom JavaScript, ramverk som Vue, Node.js
* Erfarenhet av SQL (Azure SQL Server) är meriterande
* Lösningsorienterad och service-minded
* Har ett intresse för design, användarcentrerad utveckling och öga för detaljer



  






 Som person är du nyfiken, lyhörd och är självgående och gillar att samarbeta. Du motiveras av att sätta dig in i, och utveckla kunders användarresor inom inköpsanalys. Du har en stor social förmåga och trivs med att jobba i en entreprenöriell miljö med en spännande SaaS-tjänst.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Härligt att du hittade hit! Söker du efter ditt nästa steg i karriären?**
 Sortera är en branschledande och stabil arbetsgivare som befinner sig i en spännande fas och söker nu en Data Engineer som vill vara med och driva vår verksamhet framåt. På vårt kontor i Marievik, Stockholm blir du en del av vårt IT-team med ett närvarande och coachande ledarskap.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har teknisk kompetens inom dataplattformar, integration, datamodellering och data governance – och som trivs i rollen att ta ägarskap för både lösningar och långsiktig utveckling.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en central del i utvecklingen av vår datainfrastruktur och arbeta i tvärfunktionella team tillsammans med andra inom IT-teamet och verksamhetsrepresentanter.
   

  

 Du förväntas ta ansvar, utmana kravställningar och bidra till att etablera en stabil, modern och skalbar dataplattform.
   

  

 Låter det som något för dig? Då ska du definitivt läsa vidare!
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du får arbeta med och ta ansvar för:
   

  

*Data Engineering & Infrastruktur*
* Designa, utveckla och förvalta dataplattformar och pipelines (ETL/ELT)
* Etablera, konfigurera och optimera integrationer mellan datakällor, system och plattformar
* Modellera och strukturera data för tillgänglighet, prestanda och kvalitet
* Automatisera och effektivisera dataflöden med fokus på skalbarhet och robusthet
* Delta i val av teknik, arkitektur och verktyg – med fokus på långsiktiga lösningar


*Datakvalitet & Tillförlitlighet*
* Etablera kontroller för datavalidering, datakvalitet och felsökning samt övervakning
* Implementera datastyrning (Data Governance) och strukturerad metadatahantering
* Dokumentera processer, pipeline-logik, datamodeller och tekniska lösningar


*Affärsnära analysförberedelse*
* Förstå verksamhetens behov och omsätta dem i effektiva tekniska lösningar
* Utmana kravställningar och föreslå bättre sätt att strukturera, modellera och exponera data
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklare och analytiker för att leverera tillförlitlig och lättanvänd data


*Samarbete & Agilt arbetssätt*
* Arbeta i agila team tillsammans med utvecklare, analytiker och verksamheten
* Driva tekniska uppgifter självständigt från behov till produktion
* Bidra till teknisk kunskapsdelning inom IT-teamet


**En bra start kräver en genomtänkt onboarding - vi kommer att ge dig:**
* Grundlig introduktion i våra olika bolag och våra tjänster
* Du kommer att lära känna våra olika avdelningar med erfarna kollegor
* Erfaren kollega som fadder💚
* Grymma kollegor som har roligt tillsammans


 Du kommer att utgå från vårt kontor och rapportera direkt till Jonas (ansvarig IT Service & Operations). I IT-teamet har du dessutom ett flertal fantastiska kollegor⭐. Din närmaste chef har god erfarenhet av avdelningens tjänster, ledarskap och har varit på Sortera i många år.
   

  

**Kan du vara en perfekt match för oss?**
 Vi söker dig som är en teamplayer och med ett driv att ta verksamheten framåt, såväl som ett brinnande intresse att skapa ett mer hållbart samhälle♻️.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

**Utbildning**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom datateknik, systemutveckling eller motsvarande för rollen


**Erfarenhet & teknisk kompetens**
* Flera års erfarenhet av data engineering i komplexa miljöer
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom SQL, datamodellering, databaser (relationella & NoSQL)
* Erfarenhet av ETL/ELT-pipelines och dataintegration
* Förståelse för CI/CD, versionshantering och automatiserad drift
* Förmåga att översätta affärsbehov till välfungerande tekniska datalösningar
* Van att jobba nära andra utvecklare, IT-team och kravställare i verksamheten


***Meriterande***
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade dataplattformar (t.ex. Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Erfarenhet av TimeXtender
* Kunskap inom DevOps eller infrastrukturaspekt av datahantering
* Erfarenhet av projektledning


***Personliga egenskaper***
* Lyhörd, prestigelös och tycker om att samarbeta och kommunicera med olika funktioner på företaget
* Analytisk, lösningsorienterad och bra på uppföljning
* Strukturerad och driven


**En långsiktig karriär - vi kommer att ge dig:**
* En positiv företagskultur
* Goda möjligheter att växa
* Fast lön
* Pensionsavsättningar och försäkringar etc. enligt kollektivavtal


 Har vi lyckats inspirera dig till att välja Sortera Group som din nästa arbetsgivare? Vi hoppas det! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, urval sker löpande.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior .NET utvecklare IT Spara
description:
**Att jobba som senior .NET utvecklare**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av .NET och C# och som trivs i en fullstackroll där du både bygger backend och moderna webbgränssnitt.
   

  

 Du har arbetat med frontendteknik som React, Angular eller liknande ramverk, och vill vara med och skapa en riktigt bra användarupplevelse tillsammans med teamet.
   

  

 Som systemutvecklare på Skandia så får du vara med och utveckla i vår plattform för aktie-, fondhandel samt depåsystem på Skandiabanken.
   

  

 Teamet är ett sammansvetsat gäng som gillar att tänka nytt och utveckla både vår befintliga produkt men också att bygga helt nya tjänster som hjälper människor att spara bättre. Vi är ett nyfiket team som gärna testar idéer, delar med oss av våra lärdomar och hjälper varandra att växa.
   

  

 Just nu arbetar vi med att förnya hela kundupplevelsen för fondhandel och sparverktyg, här finns gott om möjligheter att vara med och påverka och driva förändringen framåt.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som sitter på Skandias huvudkontor i Stockholm. Teamet består idag av Product Owner, Scrum master, mjukvaruarkitekt, systemutvecklare, testansvarig, produktspecialist och UX/Design. Vi jobbar med avancerad affärslogik och ett systemlandskap med hög grad av integrationer som ger en utmanande och stimulerande vardag.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till närmaste gruppchef för IT Spara.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du målmedveten, trygg och tar gärna egna initiativ för förbättringar samtidigt som du gillar att samarbeta med dina teammedlemmar. Du är nyfiken, har en vilja att lära dig både nya domäner och tekniker samt gillar att bidra i utvecklingen av teamets arbetssätt. I jobbet är du ordningsam och arbetar strukturerat även när tempot är högt.
   

  

 Du har mångårig erfarenhet som systemutvecklare inom .NET/C#. Likaså har du arbetat med SQL server och kan hantera databehandling, till exempel händelse- och meddelandehantering eller schemalagda körningar. Ett grundkrav är att du har en god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska både i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Du Har Jobbat Med Följande Verktyg**
* NET 8/9
* React
* SQL Server
* Git & REST-API:er
* Azure DevOps & Octopus Deploy
* Splunk, NServiceBus & AppDynamics


 Det är även meriterande med erfarenhet inom GitHub Copilot där vi ligger i startgropen för att börja AI-stödd systemutveckling.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Catharina Söderström catharina.soderstrom@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquisition Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

*Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
**Brinner du för AI och vill jobba med kreativa lösningar för svåra problem?** 




  





 Med oss på Arange får du möjligheten att applicera
 **Machine Learning** 
 ,
 **Data Science** 
 och
 **Mjukvaruutveckling** 
 för att skapa verkliga AI-lösningar som gör skillnad för svenska företag och organisationer.
 



  





 Vi är ett dedikerat team som söker nästa nyfikna och driftiga utvecklare med
 **stort intresse för AI** 
 . Hos oss vill vi att du ska vara med och påverka och vi vill ha med dig på resan att bygga Sveriges ledande AI-byrå.
 



  





**Du får möjlighet att jobba med att** 



* **Utveckla AI-lösningar** 
 : Bygga allt från enkla AI-applikationer baserade på LLM:er till komplexa AI-agenter och prognossystem med egenutvecklade modeller.
* **Ta strategiska och arkitekturella beslut** 
 : Vara med och forma och sätta strategier och arkitekturer för AI-baserade system och applikationer tillsammans med våra kunder.
* **Bidra till strategisk rådgivning** 
 : Stötta ledningsgrupper och linjechefer med insikter och idéer från AI:s frontlinjer, samt hålla i kundanpassade workshops inom AI.
* **Analysera data** 
 : Utföra djupgående dataanalys för att identifiera insikter och möjligheter, samt utveckla skräddarsydda modeller som optimerar verksamhetsprocesser.
* **Underhålla och optimera AI-modeller** 
 : Efter implementation ansvarar vi för drift, optimering och vidareutveckling av AI-baserade lösningar för att säkerställa att de förblir relevanta och effektiva i en föränderlig omvärld.



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* **Stort inflytande** 
 : Du kommer in under en tillväxtfas i vår resa och får stort inflytande över allt från kulturbyggande till projekt och leveranser.
* **Teknisk spets och kontinuerligt lärande** 
 : Vi värderar kunskapsdelning och lärande högt och vill tillsammans hänga med i den snabba utvecklingen inom AI.
* **Team med ambition** 
 : Vi är erfarna ingenjörer och teknikentusiaster som vill jobba nära med våra kunder och leverera nytänkande projekt som löser verkliga problem.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Är nyfiken, självgående och trivs i en snabbföränderlig miljö med stort ägandeskap.
* Trivs med stor gemenskap och brinner för kunskapsdelning.
* Är vass på Python och har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling från flera delar av utvecklingsprocessen.
* Har erfarenhet av AI/ML och datadrivna system – gärna med fokus på LLMs, RAG, agentarkitektur eller ML och MLOps.
* Har en ingenjörsexamen.
* Har minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av relevant karaktär.
* Har erfarenhet av eller är nyfiken på rollen som konsult.
* Meriterande: erfarenhet av startups, open source-utveckling eller att ha jobbat med produktnära AI-lösningar.



  





**Plats & upplägg** 




 Vi har kontor vid Slussen i Stockholm och gillar att ses ofta – och är samtidigt flexibla med hybridarbete för att du ska trivas på bästa sätt.
 



  





**Redo att vara hänga med?** 




 Ansök idag eller hör av dig direkt till oss på careers@arange.ai.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Fullstackutvecklare Risk & Hälsa
description:
**Att jobba som fullstackutvecklare**
 Du kommer att tillhöra ett team som har ansvaret för utveckling och förvaltning av applikationer inom Risk & Hälsa som exempelvis riskbedömning, utveckling och förvaltning av formulär som hälsodeklaration, skadeanmälan, ersättningsanspråk.
   

  

 Teamets huvudansvar är riskbedömningsprocessen med en digital dynamisk hälsodeklaration och automatiserade flöden för bedömning av såkallade ”rena hälsor”. Stort fokus läggs på API utveckling mellan Skandia och Lumera. Nyutveckling sker i .NET Core med React JS som frontend ramverk. Arbete sker i nära samarbete med verksamheten som är kravställare av ny funktionalitet. Teamet har alltid möjlighet att påverka design utifrån tekniska limitationer. Vi i teamet använder oss av par- och/eller mobbprogrammering används när tillfälle ges för att kunna utvecklas och lära oss av varandra.
   

  

 Teamets applikationer är byggda i både .NET Core och .NET Framework med MSSQL som databas. Alla anrop mot Skandias API:er går genom ett gemensamt tjänstelager och byggen och lyft sker via Azure DevOps samt Octopus Deploy.
   

  

 Teamet består av mjukvaruarkitekt, PO, testare och utvecklare, vi alla utgår från vårat huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till närmaste gruppchef inom IT Risk & Hälsa.
   

  

**Teamets Techstack Består Idag Bland Annat Av**
* C#
* NET Core & Framework
* React & Javascript
* REST/WCF
* SQL Server


**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Du har jobbat som systemutvecklare i några år och trivs i både frontend såväl som i backend miljö. För att lyckas i rollen har du erfarenhet av C#/ .NET Core eller liknande tekniker. Dessutom har du arbetat med React eller liknande frontendramverk. Att kunna kommunicera på svenska både i tal och skrift är ett grundkrav för tjänsten.
   

  

 Som person är du målmedveten, ansvarstagande och strävar hela tiden efter att göra det lilla extra. Du är bekväm med att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö och kan arbeta självständigt. Du en lagspelare som trivs med att samarbeta och bidra till ett öppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Kirsti Heilborn på kirsti.heilborn@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

*Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Lösningsarkitekt D365 FO
description:
Om rollen
   

  

 Är du redo för nya utmaningar? Vi söker nu en erfaren Lösningsarkitekt inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365 FO) till vår nationella Microsoft Dynamics-enhet. Hos oss på Sogeti får du en nyckelroll i att forma framtidens affärssystemlösningar för våra kunder. Som lösningsarkitekt är du både ledare och expert. Du säkerställer att våra kunder får den lösning och affärsnytta de förväntar sig – och mer därtill. Du arbetar nära våra utvecklare, konsulter och andra arkitekter, och är med från de första dialogerna till färdig lösning.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:
   

  

* Att förstå kundens verksamhet och omsätta krav till lösningsdesign.
* Att leda workshops, hålla presentationer och kommunicera med olika intressenter.
* Att utforma arkitektur och systemlösningar baserat på D365 FO:s möjligheter.
* Att arbeta med Power Platform och identifiera nya lösningar och förbättringar.
* Att bidra till kunskapsdelning inom våra nationella D365-nätverk.


 Din profil:
   

  

* Lång erfarenhet av affärssystemsimplementationer med D365 FO.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt.
