 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.
   

  

****Webb och sociala medier****
 För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida . Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn .

title: Teknisk testare inom Master Data Management till Handelsbanken
description:
*Vi söker en teknisk testare med stort intresse för tester och automatisering s* 
*om vill påverka bankens förflyttning till mer moderna och modulariserade lösningar för att hantera Masterdata.*
**Ditt team**
 Du kommer bli en del av ett team som består av Utvecklare, en Team Coach och en Produktägare. Tillsammans underhåller och vidareutvecklar vi nya tillämpningar för system och processer kring Masterdata, dvs data om Part, Produkt och Avtal, samt fullmaktshantering. Med en stark koppling mellan affär och teknik skapar vi förutsättningar för tillämpningar som skapar värde för banken idag och framåt. Vi har kul på arbetet och tror på att lösa problem tillsammans samtidigt som vi uppmuntrar nya idéer. Utöver närmsta teamet ingår du i en grupp testare för att fördjupa och dela kunskap inom testområdet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Teknisk testare kommer du ansvara över att verifiera och kvalitetssäkra leveransen mot användarna. Det innebär bland annat att du planerar, genomför och dokumenterar test men även utvecklar teamets teststrategier. Du kommer vara en del av ett nära samarbete med andra team inom- och utanför vårt område vilket innebär att du är med i alla faser av systemutvecklingen, från idé till implementering. I den tidiga fasen av systemutvecklingen kommer din förmåga att kritiskt granska krav och systemlösning vara betydelsefull för kvalitetssäkringen.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även arbetsuppgifter som att:
   

  

* Skapa och underhålla testautomatiseringsramar och skript
* Analysera testresultat och kommunicera feedback till utvecklingsteamet.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om trender inom testautomatisering och ta fram förbättringsförslag för testprocessen.


 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av rollen som testare och arbetat med tekniska tester. Du är van vid att arbeta med allt från testdesign och olika testmetoder till integrationstester, testautomation och testdriven utveckling. Din tekniska förståelse är god och du har erfarenhet av att planera och arbeta i olika systemmiljöer, tekniker och plattformar. Vi ser även att du har kunskap om testverktyg och en vana att ta fram egna testfall med hjälp av dessa. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* programmering i Java eller JavaScript
* Systemintegrationer
* Teknisk analys
* Agilt arbetssätt


 Som person ser vi att du trivs med att lösa komplexa uppgifter genom att samla in relevant information, analysera den noggrant och fatta välgrundade beslut utifrån ett helhetsperspektiv. Du har ett kvalitetstänk i allt arbete och ifrågasätter utveckling du inte förstår. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma fram till skalbara lösningar samtidigt som du håller dig uppdaterad inom testområdet. Du kan beskriva problem för andra samt varför de behöver åtgärdas. Det är viktigt att du organiserar och dokumenterar ditt arbete så att du och andra kan följa det.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Urvalsprocessen kommer att påbörjas först efter sista ansökningsdatumet.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Anders Nilson, anders.nilson@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Talent Acquisition Partner**
 : Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:**
 Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:**
 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se

title: kravanalytiker
description:
**Lediga jobb**
===============


**Tullverket söker kravanalytiker**
-----------------------------------


Är du en erfaren kravanalytiker som söker nya utmaningar? Då är det hos oss du vill vara!  

Tullverkets IT-avdelning är norra Sveriges största arbetsgivare inom IT. Hos oss får du arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppdrag där du bidrar till att effektivisera Sveriges varuflöde. Vi bygger långsiktiga agila team som bidrar till både verksamhet och samhällsnytta. Nu söker vi efter erfarna kravanalytiker, ta chansen och bli en del av gemenskapen.


**Din roll**  

  

Som kravanalytiker hos Tullverket arbetar du i tät samverkan med verksamhetens användare att samla in krav utifrån behov, för att effektivisera tullhanteringen inom t.ex. områdena import, export eller uppbörd. Hos oss får du möjlighet att använda dina befintliga kunskaper och samtidigt fördjupa dessa i en varm och stöttande miljö. Du får vara med från början till slut i hela utvecklingsprocessen, vilket ger dig en god helhetsförståelse.


**Det här är ditt uppdrag**  

  

* Samla in krav utifrån behov, både från verksamheten men även krav som kommer från EU
* Agera bryggan mellan IT och verksamhet, dvs kunna kommunicera med olika intressenter för att säkerställa att våra digitala tjänster möter verksamhetens behov
* Planera och leda workshops, kravmöten och testarbete

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**  

  

* Flexibel arbetsplats för att underlätta balans i livet. Flexibel arbetsplats ger dig möjlighet att arbeta både på kontoret i Luleå och hemifrån utifrån en nivå som passar ditt arbete, ditt team och dig. Minst en dag i veckan förväntar vi oss dock att du befinner dig på kontoret i Luleå
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter och kompetensutveckling genom utbildningar och konferenser
* Friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme varje vecka för att främja hälsa och välmående. Tullverket har även en aktiv idrottsförening i Luleå som kontinuerligt arrangerar hälsofrämjande aktiviteter
* Goda semester- och pensionsvillkor


En vänlig arbetsplats där vi värderar trivsel och kultur högt. Hos oss får du fördjupa dina kunskaper i en coachande och stöttande miljö
**Vem är du?**
  

* Du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT
* Du har flera års yrkeserfarenhet av kravanalys och testarbete
* Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt
* Du kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska

  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet  

  

* Du är kommunikativ, prestigelös och en stark lagspelare
* Du har ett driv och nyfikenhet att ständigt lära dig nytt och förbättra arbetssätt
* Du är bekväm med att samarbeta på distans då dina kollegor finns över hela Sverige
* För dig är Tullverkets värdegrund; Helhetssyn, Nytänkande, Ansvarstagande, något helt naturligt

  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**  

  

* Arbetat med testledning och UX-design
* Erfarenhet av SBE-metodiken
* Vana av att arbeta med Atlassians produkter


  

**Övrigt**  

  

Referensnummer: 2025-15083  

  

Placeringsort: Luleå  

  

Anställningsform: Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning som kan komma att inledas med 6 månaders provanställning.  

  

Individuell lönesättning tillämpas  

  

Tillträdesdag: Efter överenskommelse  

  

Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan beslut om anställning kommer du att få genomgå drogtest och bakgrundskontroll. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen genomförs före anställning, då tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Tullverket är en totalförsvarsmyndighet och vid anställning kan du komma att krigsplaceras i Tullverket.  

  

Tullverket värdesätter de kvaliteter som tillförs verksamheten genom att ha en jämn könsfördelning samt etnisk mångfald.  

**För mer information och ansökan**



Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att ringa Ida Eriksson, 0920-25 98 10 eller Kristoffer Mörtsell, 0920-25 96 88. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen går det bra att ringa Tullverkets PA-support, tel. 060-67 25 85.  

Fackliga företrädare är för OFR-P/TULL-KUST, Anders Nilsson tel. 0920-25 96 31 och för Saco-S, Eva Rutberg, tel. 0920-25 96 39.  

Din ansökan med ett **medföljande personligt brev samt CV/Meritförteckning på svenska**, ska ha inkommit till Tullverket **senast den 3:e augusti**. Du ansöker via det elektroniska ansökningsformuläret här nedan.



Vi undanber oss all kontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.


*Tullverket är en statlig myndighet som kontrollerar flödet av varor över Sveriges gränser. Med visionen att bara godkända varor ska passera gränsen hindrar vi olagliga varor från att komma in i landet och bidrar till ett tryggare samhälle. Vi förenklar handeln med andra länder och lägger grunden till ökad tillväxt och konkurrens på lika villkor. Tullverket, som grundades 1636, har i dag cirka 2 600 anställda och leds av generaltulldirektör Johan Norrman.*

  



2025-06-10

title: UX Designer – Design System & Common Components
description:
*Location:* *Main placement is Solna, Linköping or Göteborg. There may also be opportunities for placement at other Saab sites.*

Join Saab’s strategic journey to evolve defence through software, AI, and shared digital platforms — where you’ll play a vital role in enabling teams to deliver better, faster, and more unified user experiences.


Your role


We are looking for a passionate and experienced UX Designer to join the Enablement Tech & Platforms department within Group Digitalisation. In this role, you will be instrumental in shaping and maintaining our design system, developing common UI components, and supporting teams across the organisation in adopting new systems and procedures. You will work closely with the business, developers, product owners, and other designers to understand the end users perspectives and ensure a consistent and high-quality user experience across our digital products.


Key Responsibilities


* Define, maintain, and evolve the organisation’s design system and component library.
* Enabling modularity from a UX perspective as part of our modular software architecture
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and end-users to develop reusable UI components.
* Collaborate with relevant roles to ensure that aesthetics serve clarity without compromising institutional or product identity.
* Provide guidance and support to teams across the organisation in adopting the design system.
* Ensure design consistency and usability across platforms and applications.
* Advocate for user-centred design principles and best practices and, sourcing best practices for these from within Saab and from external sources using a science-based approach.
* Facilitate workshops and training sessions to promote design system usage.


You will be part of a collaborative and forward-thinking team that values innovation, quality, and user experience. We offer opportunities for professional growth, a supportive work environment, and the chance to make a meaningful impact on the digital experiences we deliver across the organisation.


Your profile


Required:

* Proven experience in UX design, with a focus on design systems and component libraries.
* Strong portfolio demonstrating design system contributions and UI/UX design skills.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
* Ability to work across teams and influence design practices at scale.
* Ability to communicate fluently in both Swedish and English.


Preferred:

* Experience working in large-scale software organisations.
* Familiarity with front-end development and component-based frameworks (e.g., React, Angular).
* Knowledge of UX in mission-critical contexts and UX to increase situational awareness.

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*

What you will be part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO**

We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our digital product team and take the lead in shaping the future of the OMNI customer journey—connecting our digital and physical stores into one seamless experience. You’ll be at the forefront of exploration: uncovering customer needs, identifying opportunities, and defining the path forward. You'll collaborate closely with product design, engineering, analytics, and store teams to connect the dots between digital and physical, ensuring every customer interaction feels effortless, inspiring, and integrated.

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:**

* Leading the discovery, delivery, and iteration of key initiatives.
* Translating customer and business needs into clear problem statements, product requirements, and prioritized backlogs.
* Collaborating closely with UX, engineering, analytics, and stakeholders to bring new experiences to life - from concept to release.
* Defining, monitoring, and reporting on success metrics that reflect impact in both digital and store.
* Driving test, experimentation, and customer validation to generate insights that inform product improvements and strategic decisions.

 **WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**


You’ll join a global, cross-functional team committed to delivering exceptional digital experiences through close collaboration, user-centric design, and continuous iteration. The team brings together diverse expertise across Product Design, Analytics, and Engineering, and partners closely with other product teams within the global digital experience organization, as well as key business stakeholders.

 **WHO YOU ARE**

*We are looking for people with…*


* Proven experience as a Senior Product Manager or in a similar role within a digital environment, ideally with OMNI experience.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* A passion for solving complex problems with innovative thinking and a clear ability to prioritize based on impact, user value, and strategic fit.
* A strong customer focus, with the ability to uncover user needs, validate pain points, and translate insights into actionable improvements.


*And people who have:*

* A data-informed mindset, using both qualitative and quantitative insights to guide decision-making
* Experience working in agile, iterative product development environments.
* A proactive, ownership-driven attitude with the ability to manage ambiguity and adapt quickly to change.
* Curiosity and a continuous improvement mindset—always looking for ways to enhance the product and the team’s ways of working.

 **WHO WE ARE**


H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  



**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**

  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

  

In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

 **JOIN US**

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.  



Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.


* *We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Bibliotekarie med inriktning mot studentstöd och lärandemiljö
description:
Lunds universitet grundades 1666 och rankas återkommande som ett av världens främsta lärosäten. Här finns omkring 47 000 studenter och mer än 8 800 medarbetare i Lund, Helsingborg och Malmö. Vi förenas i vår strävan att förstå, förklara och förbättra vår värld och människors villkor. Lunds universitet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Jämställdhet, lika villkor och mångfald är grundläggande principer för alla delar av vår verksamhet.


Ekonomihögskolan vid Lunds universitet är en internationellt framstående handelshögskola som har s k trippel kvalitetsackreditering. Vi arbetar i en internationell miljö och har eftertraktade utbildningar på grund-, masters- och forskarnivå. Ekonomihögskolan har ett nära samarbete med företag och myndigheter såväl nationellt som internationellt. Vi månar om en god, stimulerande arbetsmiljö och arbetar kontinuerligt med att utvecklas som en attraktiv arbetsgivare.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Som bibliotekarie vid Ekonomihögskolans bibliotek kommer du att ha både egna ansvarsområden och gemensamma arbetsuppgifter tillsammans med kollegor, främst inom bibliotekets Team studentstöd och Team lärandemiljö. Inom studentstöd är integrerad undervisning central och att undersöka effekten av vår undervisning och övriga stöd till fakultetens studenter, som har stark internationell prägel, är ett fokusområde i tjänsten.


I rollen ingår att tillsammans med kollegor planera, genomföra och utvärdera UX-undersökningar, enkäter och intervjuer som vi regelbundet utför med våra primära målgrupper. Vår verksamhet präglas av stark användarinvolvering, och en kontinuerlig dialog med användarna är en central del av arbetet.


Lärandemiljön utvecklas och förbättras löpande, och i tjänsten ingår att omsätta användarnas önskemål i praktiken. Det innebär även att omvärldsbevaka samt testa nya lösningar och metoder för att skapa en trivsam och funktionell lärandemiljö. Du kommer också att presentera inför grupper av varierande storlek samt kunna hantera olika typer av workshopformat, tex arbete med våra ”Reading & writing retreats” samt ”Uppsatsveckan”.

### **Kvalifikationer**

### **Du har**

* Examen i biblioteks- och informationsvetenskap
* Förståelse för hur enkäter, intervjuer och undersökningar genomförs
* Förståelse för hantering och lagring av insamlad information
* God kommunikativ förmåga både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska och engelska
* God samarbetsförmåga

### **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av arbete på forsknings- och högskolebibliotek och/eller visa en god förståelse för verksamhetsområdet.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med enkäter, intervjuer och UX - undersökningar.
* Erfarenhet för hur studentstöd inom ekonomi kan utformas och utvecklas.
* Erfarenhet av och kunskap om andra funktioner som finns på forskningsbibliotek
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med lärandemiljö och studieplatser
* Samtida inblick och förståelse för universitetsstudier

### **Övrigt**


Startdatum är 1 september eller enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer kommer sker i slutet av augusti.


Vi undanber oss alla kontakter från annonsförsäljare, rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag på grund av statliga upphandlingsregler.


Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Lund | Län: Skåne län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PA2025/2212 | Kontakt: Katrin Nylén +46462229576, Daniel Gunnarsson +46462220382, | Facklig företrädare: OFR/ST:Fackförbundet ST:s kansli 046-2229362, SACO:Saco-s-rådet vid Lunds universitet kansli@saco-s.lu.se, SEKO: Seko Civil 046-2229366, | Publicerat: 2025-07-07 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-28

title: Product Manager Jackpot
description:
Jackpot Product Manager
  
We are looking for a Jackpot Product Manager who will help us with the responsibility for making Relax Gaming’s Jackpot products the best in the world. The ideal candidate has outstanding knowledge of jackpot products and software development lifecycle in order to be able to take our services to the next level.
  
Do you enjoy working closely with internal stakeholders and are you confident & passionate about driving
  
the end-to-end success of a product? Are you a natural in defining the roadmap, acting as a bridge between tech and business, as well as have a creative mind for new ideas? If so, we’d love to hear from you. 
  
You will be responsible for contributing towards the success of our Jackpot products including
  
**Product Strategy:** collaborate with stakeholders and help execute the overall product strategy for our Jackpot portfolio, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs.
  
**Feature Conceptualisation and Prioritization:** define and prioritize features based on market trends, player and customer feedback, and business goals to enhance the gaming experience.
  
**Requirements Analysis:** gather requirements and create detailed scope documentation.
  
**Delivery:** lead the product release plan and set expectations for delivery of new functionalities.
  
**User Experience:** champion a user-centric approach and ensure that the Jackpot products meet high standards of usability, accessibility, and overall player satisfaction.
  
**Testing and Quality Assurance:** Collaborate with QA teams to ensure rigorous testing, identifying and addressing any issues or bugs to maintain high quality standards.
  
**Internal Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and marketing to drive product development from concept to launch.
  
**Data-Driven Decision Making:** Utilize analytics and player data to make informed decisions, track product performance, and identify areas for improvement.
  
**Regulatory Compliance:** Stay informed about and ensure compliance with relevant gaming regulations, working closely with legal and compliance teams.
  
**Stakeholder Communication:** Regularly communicate with stakeholders, providing updates on product development, performance metrics, and any challenges or opportunities.
  
**Market Analysis:** Conduct market research and analysis to identify opportunities for innovation, competitive positioning, and differentiation in the iGaming industry.
  
Work in collaboration with the Account Management team to handle customer facing aspects of the Jackpot product, including training/presentations, handling issues raised by customers and support set up of promotions
  
  

**We are looking for someone with:**  

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Marketing, Computer Science.)
  
Proven experience as a Product Manager or similar role in the iGaming industry.
  
2+ years of experience working with Jackpot products.
  
Strong understanding of casino gaming trends, player behaviour, and market dynamics.
  
Excellent communication, collaboration, and product management skills.
  
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment.
  
Experience working with Atlassian suite or similar.
  
  

**You’ll have us extra excited if you have:**  

Understanding of UI/UX design best practices and ability to create simple mock-ups.
  
Understanding, at least conceptually, of common systems integration methodologies (decoupling of systems, APIs, task queues etc.).
  
Good understanding of gaming mechanics, games studios and games trends.
  
  

This role will be reporting to the Jackpot Business Owner.
  
About Relax Gaming
  
Relax Gaming Group was founded in 2010 with the goal of creating games for the modern iGaming landscape. Always staying true to the Relax core values - Driven, Adaptable, Supportive, and Respectful - the recent and rapid expansion has been conceived in order to deliver unparalleled global reach. Via a quick one-time integration, Relax Gaming now provides access to a roster of 1500+ casino games and a diverse range of proprietary products, including Poker, Bingo, and its own rapidly expanding slot portfolio.
  
The high-quality aggregated content is provided through its selected Silver Bullet (commercially represented) and Powered By Relax (commercially independent) partners. Regulated markets are also at the heart of its growth strategy, with both fully supported regulated markets as well as licenses held in multiple jurisdictions. Keen to find out more? Learn about us here.
  
Life at Relax
  
Relax is at a very exciting growth stage as a company; however, we cherish our informal and flexible core atmosphere where self-initiative, taking pride in what you do and ambition to deliver the best results are key components. For the right person, there are endless opportunities for personal and professional development.

title: Senior Business Development Director
description:
This is us At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.
  
This is the job As a Senior Business Development Director at Avenga your main focus will be nurturing, expanding and attracting key clients in Sweden, Nordics and selected strategic global accounts. With a background in IT and Sales you understand the industry and the complexity of selling comprehensive bespoke software solutions, projects and consultancy. The role will involve both nurturing current relationships and seeking out new ones with a consultative selling approach.
  
You’ll find yourself in an environment where you can influence the way we work and make the difference. That is why it involves a high level of collaboration with Pre-sales teams, Delivery, Engineering, Marketing and well as with the ELT member on the go-to market strategies. The role includes operational aspects such as continuous dialogue with new and existing clients regarding pre-sales, quotas, business development account planning, and coordination with delivery. But also attending different sales events and working strategically with the marketing team.
  
This is you You consider yourself to be a socially skilled and autonomous person who’s experienced in consultative selling in the Tech and Consultancy industry. You have a proven track-record of similar roles where you’ve been working with big clients within the IT-industry in Sweden, Nordics and/or Global markets, it’s also a big plus if you’re used to working with clients within the Retail and HiTech industry.
  
With your experience in account management, you know how to handle key accounts and understand driving values through the tailored business development routines that come with it. Since we’re an international organization it’s also a plus if you’re accustomed to working in such and know how to utilize the strength and benefits that come with it.
  
  

**Skills:**  

You should be comfortable applying consultative selling approach within daily business development routines
  
You’re used to working in both Swedish and English, spoken and written, since this is an international organization
  
Proven track-record from similar roles within the IT-industry, preferably within IT-consultancy
  
Handling and developing communications and partnership with different stakeholders within customer organization including C-levels
  
Proven track-record from working with international clients as well as the ones in the Nordics
  
Experienced in handling and nurturing big clients and projects
  
Knowledge and experience in Information technology systems analysis and maintenance
  
  

What awaits you at Avenga? Through our values, Better Minds, Bolder Ideas and Bigger Hearts, we strive to provide you with the tools, the autonomy, the trust, and assistance you need to excel. Enjoy benefits like private health insurance, well-being programs, flexible and hybrid work models, laptops and gear, trainings, language classes, social events, great offices, and more. We take pride in the diverse skills and character of our teams, welcoming everyone to apply and contribute to our collective strength. We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which could mean that the process ends before the final application date, so don't wait to apply.
company_description: Avenga is an international consultancy and technology solutions partner with 6000+ specialists globally.

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an 6-month Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Proficient in Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: UX Lead
description:
Telness Tech is on a mission to simplify and digitize the telecom industry. Our platform powers next-generation mobile providers—from traditional MVNOs to eSIM challengers and non-telecom brands embedding connectivity. With our roots in Stockholm and global ambitions, we’re building the future of telecom: fast, flexible, and customer-first.
 







 We’re looking for a UX Lead to ensure our platform remains intuitive and impactful as we scale across markets and user types.
 







**About the role** 



 As UX Lead at Telness Tech, you’ll shape our end-to-end product experience -bringing clarity to complexity and ensuring our platform is intuitive for customers, operators, and end-users. You’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to design thoughtful, scalable solutions to technically complex problems.
   

  

 You’ll drive the design process from discovery to delivery, combining hands-on design with strategic leadership and contributing directly to high-impact product initiatives. You’ll be instrumental in aligning design with product strategy, evolving our design system, and embedding user-centric thinking into every stage of development.
 








**In this role, you will:** 



* Own design strategy across products—balancing usability, scalability, and brand consistency.
* Design end-to-end flows and interfaces for complex systems with multiple user types.
* Partner with the CPO and PMs to explore, learn, and shape a forward-thinking product strategy that keeps us ahead of the market.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align design with business goals and technical constraints.
* Lead and mentor a small design team, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team.
* Iterate based on feedback and data to continuously improve the user experience.







**What you bring to the table:** 



* 8+ years of experience in product design with a strong emphasis on UX.
* A track record of designing intuitive solutions for complex products with multiple user types.
* Experience in high-growth product or SaaS environments; startup experience is a plus.
* Proven leadership experience, including mentoring and leading other designers.
* Expert proficiency in Figma and managing shared design systems.
* Skilled in user research, usability testing, and turning insights into actionable design.
* Able to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Comfortable balancing business goals with user needs to drive product success.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high proficiency in English.







**Why Telness Tech?** 




 We’re not building for telco as it is—we’re building for how it should be: fast-moving, easy to use, and built for the people who use it. At Telness Tech, you’ll join a curious, ambitious, and transparent team. We work hard, we move fast, and we support each other every step of the way.
 







 Here’s what you can expect:
 


* Be part of an exciting startup journey with strong funding and international expansion.
* Play an active role in building one of the telecom industry’s most innovative companies.
* A high-trust, high-autonomy environment where you’ll be encouraged to take ownership and explore growth opportunities for both Telness Tech and your development.
* A friendly, positive, and supportive workplace that fosters collaboration and constructive challenge.
* Complimentary daily breakfast, regular "Friday" AWs, and fun activities!
* Hybrid/remote work setup with an office in central Stockholm.







 Sounds like your challenge? Let’s talk.
 







*Currently, we are not able to offer relocation or visa sponsorship.*

title: Junior product manager
description:
At Curoflow, we’re redefining how healthcare works for patients and providers across Europe. Our all-in-one digital platform – a “Shopify for healthcare” – enables clinics to deliver seamless, secure, patient-focused healthcare. With customers in 7 countries and game-changing product launches on the horizon, we’re scaling fast – and now we’re looking for a Junior product owner ready to grow with us.
 



  





 This isn’t just another product role. It’s your chance to take ownership early, shape healthcare’s digital future, and grow into a senior product leadership position in a company set to make global impact.
 



 We don’t do things the way many does. You will notice this when you meet our team. We are a growing group of 22 individuals split over two offices, striving to make global impact. We are determined, eager and willing to do what it takes to build the next great healthtech company made in Sweden! 
 



  





 We see the product department as the heart of Curoflow, with the potential to be extremely powerful. When working at Curoflow, you will not only join a mission that will impact millions of lives - you will also have the luxury of getting stuck in, defining a modern B2B company.
 



  





 And let’s be honest. Curoflow is a start-up. If you’re looking for a hefty pay rise or a strict 9-5 job, Curoflow is not for you. We want people who are willing to give that bit extra and in return get that bit extra in terms of stock options, a good salary, and a fantastic mission to join. 
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




  





 As a Junior product owner, you’ll be part of our small but dynamic product team, focusing on strengthening the quality, configuration, and scalability of our product, stretching from defining user requirements and testing, to integrations with EHRs, lab portals, and other healthcare systems.
 



 This is a hands-on role where you’ll bridge the gap between business, users, and tech – ensuring we deliver best-in-class solutions to our customers.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 




  




* Define requirements and specifications for features and integrations together with the product team
* Contribute to design decisions
* Translate user needs into user stories, mockups, and test scenarios
* Collaborate across teams on roadmap priorities, sprint planning, and release management
* Document onboarding flows and technical requirements with partners and customers
* Contribute to quality assurance and documentation per MDR and ISO standards
* Perform integration testing, data mapping, and validation against external systems
* Conduct functional testing of new features and integrations (web & mobile)



  





 We’re looking for someone who combines technical curiosity, structured thinking, and a passion for learning:
 



  





**Required** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Systems Science)
* Basic understanding of SaaS and system integrations (e.g. APIs, data models)
* Familiarity with product development models (e.g. Kano, user journeys)
* Strong attention to detail and structured work style
* Excellent communication skills – written and verbal – particularly for documentation and technical specifications
* Self-motivated and eager to take ownership of your work
* Comfortable collaborating with development teams and using tools like Jira, Confluence, or similar



  





**Nice to have** 




  




* Master’s degree in a relevant field
* Knowledge of healthcare standards (e.g. HL7, FHIR) or experience with MDR/ISO 13485
* Experience in regulated technical environments (healthtech a big plus)
* Familiarity with design/prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, Lucidchart)
* Understanding of REST APIs and basic frontend/backend logic



  





**About you** 




  





 You’re driven, detail-oriented, and thrive in fast-moving environments. You enjoy solving complex problems and aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done. You see feedback as fuel and want to grow into a leadership role over time.
 



  





**Why Join Us?** 




  





 Impact: Shape the future of healthcare for millions across Europe
 



 Growth: Be part of a fast-growing start-up with big ambitions
 



 Ambition: Join a company where everyone is working with that extra bit of conviction, knowing they can be the change they want to see
 



 Career Path: We premier in-house promotions and you’ll be setting your own limitations 
 



 Culture: A passionate, founder-led team who care deeply about healthcare and product
 



  





**Working conditions** 




  




* Full time
* Location: Stockholm, Scheelegatan
* Work from home policy: 1 day/week
* Benefits besides salary include, wellness grants, occupational pension, flexible working hours and the possibility of receiving equity options



  





 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our digital product team and take the lead in shaping the future of the OMNI customer journey—connecting our digital and physical stores into one seamless experience. You’ll be at the forefront of exploration: uncovering customer needs, identifying opportunities, and defining the path forward. You'll collaborate closely with product design, engineering, analytics, and store teams to connect the dots between digital and physical, ensuring every customer interaction feels effortless, inspiring, and integrated.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

* Leading the discovery, delivery, and iteration of key initiatives.
* Translating customer and business needs into clear problem statements, product requirements, and prioritized backlogs.
* Collaborating closely with UX, engineering, analytics, and stakeholders to bring new experiences to life - from concept to release.
* Defining, monitoring, and reporting on success metrics that reflect impact in both digital and store.
* Driving test, experimentation, and customer validation to generate insights that inform product improvements and strategic decisions.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll join a global, cross-functional team committed to delivering exceptional digital experiences through close collaboration, user-centric design, and continuous iteration. The team brings together diverse expertise across Product Design, Analytics, and Engineering, and partners closely with other product teams within the global digital experience organization, as well as key business stakeholders.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Proven experience as a Senior Product Manager or in a similar role within a digital environment, ideally with OMNI experience.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* A passion for solving complex problems with innovative thinking and a clear ability to prioritize based on impact, user value, and strategic fit.
* A strong customer focus, with the ability to uncover user needs, validate pain points, and translate insights into actionable improvements.


*And people who have:*
* A data-informed mindset, using both qualitative and quantitative insights to guide decision-making
* Experience working in agile, iterative product development environments.
* A proactive, ownership-driven attitude with the ability to manage ambiguity and adapt quickly to change.
* Curiosity and a continuous improvement mindset—always looking for ways to enhance the product and the team’s ways of working.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Game Engineer UI/UX
description:
At Embark, we want to empower everyone to create games!
   

  

 You will be working on our live service game THE FINALS, a first-person shooter, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 As a Game Engineer UI/UX you will have a creative role, working together with designers, other engineers, artists, and user experience (UX) researchers to improve and develop new features for our game. Here you will have the opportunity to take responsibility for our game’s user interface and player experience.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who will help improve our UI framework and components with a special focus on performance, tooling and scalability.
   

  

 The game we’re making is built in Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Implement C++ UI core technology in Unreal (e.g. Slate)
* Implement UI features in Unreal Engine using a mix of C++, Angelscript and Unreal Blueprints
* Collaborate with a wide range of talents at Embark to deliver a great user experience, better tools and a performant and top of the line UI


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* 5+ years of experience working within the game industry
* A strong background in C++
* Knowledge of using Unreal Engine with Slate/UMG
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
company_industry: Blockchain Services, Technology, Information and Internet, and Information Services
description:
**About Spritju**
**Spritju is building the future of energy traceability.** 
 Our SaaS platform helps businesses track, verify, and report their renewable energy use — supporting real-time climate action, sustainability reporting, and regulatory compliance.
   

  

 By simplifying how companies verify their energy sources (through streamlined energy certificate procurement) and report their usage, we bring transparency to energy consumption. As regulations increasingly require more granular verification, we’re working toward a visionary goal: building a platform that matches every kilowatt-hour of consumed energy with its generation source in real time. This is the core project we want your help with.
   

  

 We envision a future where every organization stands behind its sustainability claims — creating space for real impact, incentivizing renewable energy production, and enabling genuine climate transition, hour by hour.
   

  

 We’re a fast-moving, mission-driven startup. Join us as we work toward a world where clean, traceable energy is the standard.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for someone who’s ready to take the lead and grow into a long-term partner, someone who’s excited to build ownership and shape the future of our company. This CTO role is equity-based (we're not yet offering salaries), but it comes with the opportunity to join the founding team, own your work, and grow alongside what you’re building.
   

  

 We understand you might have another job for financial stability. This role and our company isn’t a regular 9-5, we’re looking for people who build for themselves, and who are responsible and driven by the success of what we’re creating.
   

  

 What matters most is that you’re motivated to prioritize the success of Spritju and excited to build something meaningful from the ground up. You’ll be a key part of our founding team, with the freedom to shape the product and eventually build your own team.
   

  

 Our platform helps companies trace, verify, and report their renewable energy use. We already have a working MVP (https://app.spritju.com/), and we’re now focused on improving how it works and feels for users. That’s where you come in.
   

  

**What You’ll Work On**
 💡 Real-world feature development 📈 User behavior and UX optimization ⚙️ Automating energy data imports (from sensors or APIs) 🧩 24/7 traceability visualizations and dashboards
   

  

**Project Examples**
* Refactor navigation, layout and title structure to improve clarity, usability and performance
* Improve the UX and design of our dashboards and marketplace
* Design cleaner, more intuitive interfaces for dashboards and energy data
* Improve how buyers and sellers interact in our marketplace (e.g. simplify order flows)
* Set up automated or simplified data updates (e.g. for market prices)
* Build smart, automated API connections (e.g. connect directly to clients’ energy meters)
* Streamline account management and user permissions


 It’s a hands-on role that would be ideal for someone who wants to get involved, shape a growing climate-tech product, and make a real impact in the clean energy space. You won’t be starting from scratch, we have a working MVP and live user feedback. We’re now focused on improving usability, trust, and speed as we scale.
   

  

 If you’re someone who gets things done, enjoys solving practical problems, and wants to build for the future, we’d love to talk.
   

  

**About You**
 We’d love to hear from you if you’re:
   

  

* Familiar with HTML/CSS/Bootstrap (or eager to learn fast)
* Curious about SaaS, climate tech, or blockchain
* Detail-oriented and proactive—comfortable in a startup environment
* Bonus if you’ve worked with APIs, EACs, or data dashboards before
* Passionate about sustainability and product innovation


**Preferred Skills & Qualities**
* Basic understanding of product development or software engineering principles.
* Familiarity with web development basics (HTML, CSS, Bootstrap).
* Curiosity about blockchain technology and SaaS platforms.
* Team-oriented and eager to work collaboratively.


**🌱 Bonus**
* Familiarity with energy markets, traceability, or sustainability platforms
* Experience with API integrations or automating data pipelines
* Previous work in an early-stage SaaS startup


**Why Spritju?**
 At Spritju, you’ll join a pioneering movement toward a sustainable, traceable energy future. Here’s what we offer:
   

  

* Flexible Hours & Remote Work Options
* Equity Package Opportunities for those who grow with us
* Skill Development in a rapidly expanding field
* Work-Life Balance in a supportive environment


 If you're ready to contribute to impactful work and help shape the future of sustainable energy technology, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Curious to know more about us? Check out:
   

  

**🌐 Spritju Website: https://www.spritju.com/**
**🔗 Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/spritju-com/**

title: Product Owner
description:
Do you have a passion for delivering exceptional products and a keen eye for quality? We are looking for a Senior Product Owner who thrives on turning customer needs into polished, high-performing solutions. If you are detail-oriented, collaborative, and dedicated to excellence, we would love to have you on our team!
   

  

 The team that you would be joining at DeLaval is dedicated to creating innovative online services that monitor and maintain equipment, such as IoT devices, used in modern farming. By leveraging cutting-edge technology, we provide real-time insights into the performance of farming equipment, helping our customers optimize efficiency and ensure the well-being of their animals. Our cross-functional teams work collaboratively to design, develop, and maintain these services, ensuring that they meet the highest standards of reliability, ease of use, and value for our global customer base. Through these services, we enable farmers to make data-driven decisions and enhance their productivity.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Include**
* Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with development, design, and project management teams to ensure the product meets both user needs and business goals. Empower the team to make technical decisions, while offering guidance on product priorities and objectives.
* Backlog Ownership and Prioritization: Own and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring that features and enhancements are aligned with business value and customer needs. Collaborate with the team to refine and break down requirements into actionable user stories.
* Empower Technical Decision-Making: Foster an environment where developers take technical ownership and make decisions on how to implement product features. Provide the context and goals but trust the team to find the best solutions based on their expertise.
* Requirements Definition and Storytelling: Work with stakeholders and project managers to gather insights, define clear product requirements, and document user stories that are easily understandable and actionable by the development team.
* Decision-Making and Trade-offs: Make data-informed decisions about product features, releases, and priorities, while considering technical feasibility and resource constraints. Balance short-term and long-term goals to maximize impact.
* Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for product-related communication, managing expectations and ensuring stakeholders are informed about progress, timelines, and changes.
* Foster Team Autonomy: Promote a culture of trust and accountability within the team, where developers are empowered to make the right technical decisions, ensuring they feel supported and aligned with the product's vision.
* Iterative Improvement: Gather feedback, analyze user data, and collaborate with the team to continuously improve the product, delivering incremental value and evolving based on real-world insights.
* Visualize and Communicate Progress: Continuously communicate product progress to project managers and key stakeholders. Provide clear and consistent updates using dashboards, reports, and status meetings to ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency on timelines, risks, and achievements. Proactively addressing any blockers or risks, and ensuring the team remains focused on delivering high-quality, valuable features.
* Validate Features: Validate features developed by the team to ensure they meet the defined product requirements and user needs. This includes reviewing completed features, conducting acceptance testing, and collaborating with QA to ensure the highest quality standards. Provide feedback to ensure the delivered features align with the product vision and meet business goals.


**Required Experience And Skills**
* Proven experience as a Product Owner or in a similar role, with a strong focus on delivering customer-centric products in an agile environment.
* Experience with backlog management, prioritization, and working closely with development teams to ensure features are delivered efficiently.
* Ability to empower and trust development teams with technical decision-making, while providing clear context and direction on product goals and priorities.
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively across teams, balancing product goals with technical constraints, and ensuring alignment between business and technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban) with a focus on continuous delivery and iterative improvement.
* Strong communication skills, including the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Critical thinking and problem-solving skills, with a knack for balancing short-term tactical needs with long-term strategic goals.
* Ability to make decisions based on data and feedback, and adjust priorities as needed to maximize product impact.
* Passion for creating great products and working in a collaborative, autonomous team culture.
* Experience working in distributed or remote teams.
* Attention to Detail in Validation: Strong attention to detail to review and validate features post-development to ensure they meet the required standards and fulfill the business needs.


**Bonus Skills (optional)**
* Familiarity with UX/UI design principles and experience collaborating with design teams to enhance the user experience.
* Knowledge of data analytics and using data to inform product decisions.
* Experience in technical product management or working closely with engineering teams on complex product features.
* Understanding of cloud technologies and modern software architectures.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behavior. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviors: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely; however, employees are expected to be in the office at least three days per week.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. During the holiday period, it may take some time before you hear from us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Janusz Frankowski, janusz.frankowski@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Game Designer (Combat)
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for an experienced Game Designer (Combat) to join our team to work on an unannounced AAA title. Avalanche Studios is the division dedicated to ambitious, externally published, AAA open-world games like the Just Cause series, Mad Max, and Rage 2. As a Game Designer (Combat) in Avalanche Studios, you will be responsible for designing, creating, and balancing combat related content and systems using our in-house tools.In this position, you will collaborate closely with the Narrative Designers, Gameplay and System Designers, Animators, Coders, Sound Designers, Artists, and other key stakeholders to effectively realize the vision for the game’s combat experience.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Design stylized character combat mechanics & content while collaborating with other team members to build engaging combat experiences
* Utilize our in-house tools to prove & grow player character mechanics and AI enemy mechanics
* Adjust play balance based on feedback
* Support process workflows & regularly communicate status of tasks


**Who You Are**
* Solid working experience as a gameplay designer, preferably with a combat focus
* Experience from at least one released title containing combat elements
* Experience working with game editors such as UnrealEd/Hammer
* Basic understanding of programming and, ideally, scripting experience/knowledge (Python, LUA or equal)
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Product Owner
description:
Do you want to help shape how modern DevOps solutions drive digital development in a growing company?
 



  





 We are looking for a strategic and action-oriented
 **Product Owner for DevOps** 
 in SD Worx HR who is ready to take responsibility for our internal platforms and tools that enable our development teams to deliver faster, more securely and more intelligently. DevOps and platform engineering are built together with full tribe commitment.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As the Product Owner for DevOps in SD Worx HR, you will be responsible for defining, prioritizing, and communicating the vision for our DevOps platform. You will act as the bridge between development teams, IT operations, security, and the business side. You will work closely with our technical specialists to ensure we have robust CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, monitoring, automation and security integrated into our development process.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities:** 



* Own and develop the product vision and backlog for the DevOps platform
* Mentor the tribe and DevOps squad in DevOps mindset and skill sets
* Prioritize requirements and features in collaboration with development teams, architects and stakeholders
* Use data-driven insights to identify bottlenecks and opportunities for improvement
* Coordinate initiatives to increase automation, security and performance
* Ensure the usability and efficiency of DevOps processes
* Stay up to date with trends in DevOps and related technologies



 We use an agile environment with established build and deploy pipelines in Azure DevOps.
 



  





**What we are looking for:** 




 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced
 **Product Owner** 
 to lead and manage our DevOps initiatives. This role is essential in aligning technical capabilities with business objectives, ensuring the continuous improvement and reliability of our development and operational workflows.
 



  





 If you have got some of the following qualifications, do not hesitate to send us your application:
 


* Experience as a Product Owner, Technical Project Manager or similar role within DevOps, infrastructure or development
* University degree or similar knowledge acquired in other ways
* Curious and eager-to-learn mindset
* English, both written and spoken
* Solid understanding of CI/CD, containers, operating systems, virtualization, IaC, public cloud platforms, databases, observability and backlog management
* Enjoy working closely with developers, architects, and operations staff on daily basis
* Work in a structured and goal-oriented way with the ability to make things happen



  





 Some of the technologies and tools that you’ll be using:
 


* Microsoft Azure DevOps (backlog planning, CI/CD, runbooks)
* Nutanix (virtualization layer)
* Linux and Windows Docker, Docker swarm (containerization)
* MS SQL, MongoDB, Redis, RabbitMQ, MSMQ (data providers and data transportation)
* Azure, Google, Apple and more (API management)
* Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace, Redgate, Elastic, Splunk (observability)
* Veracode, Trivy, SonarQube, Rapid7, Sentinel One, GitGuardian (security)
* Power BI (analytics and reporting)



  





**About us** 




 We work with modern tools and technologies and constantly try new approaches to simplify and make our solution more efficient. In our weekly workshops we constantly improve tooling and processes based on suggestions from the team members themselves.
 



 Most important to us is your wellbeing, and that there’s a balance in life. Our office is located in Sundbyberg, Stockholm or Espoo, Helsinki, but if you have the need to work from home some days of the week that’s no issue.
 



  





**SD Worx** 




 In today’s new world of work, people want to be inspired by what they do and have the freedom to focus on what matters. Organizations need a dynamic, motivated workforce empowered by smart technology. As a leading European provider of people solutions, SD Worx turns HR into a source of value for their customers’ business and the people that work for them. SD Worx delivers people solutions across the entire employee lifecycle, from paying employees to attracting, rewarding, and developing the talent who make businesses succeed. SD Worx powers performance through four core capabilities: technology, outsourcing, expertise, and data-driven insights. More than 76,000 small and large organizations across the globe place their trust in SD Worx and its +75 years' worth of experience. SD Worx offers its people solutions in 150 countries, calculates the salaries of approximately 5 million employees and ranks among the top five worldwide. The more than 5,300 employees at SD Worx operate in eighteen countries: Belgium (HQ), Austria, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Mauritius, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and the UK. In 2020, SD Worx achieved a consolidated turnover of more than EUR 825 million (pro forma). More info on www.sdworx.com / Follow us via LinkedIn and Twitter
