 —as well as our r
 **egional marketing teams** 
 and the
 **Attribution Lead** 
 to ensure that attribution insights are embedded in decision-making and drive measurable business impact.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* At least 3-5 years of experience with digital advertising, large marketing-related organizations, or measurement suppliers
* Experience with advertising agencies or complex marketing data-driven organizations preferred
* Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, attribution, or media mix modeling
* Knowledge of digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
* Knowledge of digital media platforms & attribution such as Google Ads, meta ads, TikTok
* Familiarity with privacy-first innovation for measurement systems
* Strong business acumen with the ability to connect attribution insights to broader marketing and commercial objectives.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and supporting marketing or media planning functions.
* A collaborative team player with a proactive mindset and a passion for data-driven marketing in a fast-paced, global environment.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: System Engineer - Customer Care
description:
**Systemingenjör till Ascom – Var med och gör skillnad inom vård och säkerhet**
 I över 160 år har Ascom drivit innovation framåt. Med över 1300 medarbetare globalt är vi en ledande leverantör av ICT- och mobilitetslösningar, med fokus på att utveckla affärskritiska realtidslösningar för miljöer där rörlighet, stabilitet och tid är avgörande faktorer.
   

  

 Du har troligen redan kommit i kontakt med en Ascom-lösning – utan att veta om det. Våra system arbetar ofta i bakgrunden, till exempel inom klinisk kommunikation och larm på sjukhus, välfärdsteknik inom äldreomsorgen, säkerhetssystem på anstalter och mobila larmsystem. Vi bidrar till digitaliseringen av vården i Sverige och våra lösningar skapar trygghet för både patienter och personal. Att arbeta hos oss är därför både meningsfullt och spännande – och vi anställer bara de bästa och gör vårt yttersta för att behålla och utveckla dem!
   

  

 På Ascom Sverige är vi cirka 240 kollegor, många med lång erfarenhet och djup kompetens inom sina områden. Din utveckling är viktig för oss – både genom samarbete och utbildning – och du får möjlighet att delta i både globala och lokala initiativ och projekt.
   

  

**Nu söker vi en Systemingenjör till vårt Customer Care-team!**
 Du blir en del av ett ambitiöst team som arbetar tätt tillsammans för att ge våra kunder bästa möjliga service och uppföljning – både på plats och på distans.
   

  

 I rollen som systemingenjör får du arbeta med teknik i framkant inom vårdsektorn och bidra till lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad i samhället. Du kommer även att arbeta med våra personlarmssystem inom säkerhetssegmentet, exempelvis på anstalter.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera tekniska incidenter av varierande svårighetsgrad, både på plats hos kund och via fjärrsupport
* Säkerställa hög kundnöjdhet genom god uppföljning, dokumentation och rapportering
* Felsöka och åtgärda både hårdvaru- och mjukvaruproblem
* Upprätthålla god kommunikation med kund och bidra med en positiv attityd
* Delta i beredskapstjänstgöring (24/7) efter introduktion
* Medverka i projekt för etablering av nya Ascom-system
* Utföra driftsättning, testning och kontraktsarbete
* Arbeta med system för kritisk kommunikation och hög säkerhet
* Samarbeta med tekniker och projektledare i teamet
* Testa och uppgradera kundlösningar
* Arbeta i säkerhetsklassade miljöer, såsom anstalter


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Gillar att resa – de flesta uppdrag sker ute hos kund
* Har B-körkort
* Kan genomgå och godkännas i säkerhetsprövning (krav)


**Din Bakgrund**
* Avslutad gymnasieutbildning med inriktning el/tele eller liknande
* Eftergymnasial utbildning med praktik är meriterande
* Kunskap inom telekommunikation och nätverk (TCP/IP, SIP)
* Erfarenhet som servicetekniker är ett plus
* Van att arbeta med digitala verktyg och har god datorvana
* Ingenjörsmässig noggrannhet och professionalism
* Erfarenhet av kundservice och projektarbete är meriterande
* Intresse för GSM, 4G, Wi-Fi är ett plus


**Dina Personliga Egenskaper**
* Du är bra på att bemöta människor och dokumentera ditt arbete
* Du arbetar strukturerat och med hög kvalitet
* Du är en lagspelare som också kan arbeta självständigt och planera din dag
* Du lär dig snabbt och har ett intresse för teknik och IT
* Du behärskar svenska flytande (krav) och har goda kunskaper i engelska


**Vi Erbjuder**
* Ett roligt, varierande och meningsfullt arbete där du får träffa och hjälpa människor inom vård och säkerhet
* Ett sammansvetsat team med hög professionalism och mycket skratt
* Möjlighet till utveckling genom Ascoms interna utbildningar
* Chansen att påverka och bidra till Ascoms framtid
* En stimulerande arbetsdag där du ständigt lär dig nytt
* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete


**Låter det intressant?** 
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på: www.ascom.com
   

  

 Ascom är en arbetsgivare som värdesätter mångfald, jämlikhet och inkludering. Vi välkomnar sökande från alla bakgrunder och diskriminerar inte utifrån kön, ålder, etnicitet, religion, sexuell läggning, funktionsvariation eller annan skyddad tillhörighet. Vi tror att en mångfaldig arbetsstyrka stärker vårt team, driver innovation och skapar en bättre arbetsmiljö för alla.
   

  

- 

*For over 160 years, Ascom has driven innovation. With over 1300 employees, we are a global provider of ICT and mobility solutions, focusing on developing business-critical, real-time solutions for environments where mobility, stability, and time are central factors.*
 You have probably benefited from an Ascom solution without knowing it. Our solutions work behind the scenes, such as clinical communication and alarms in hospitals, welfare technology in elderly care, security systems in prisons and mobile alarm systems. We are helping to digitalize the healthcare sector in Sweden and our solutions ensure that both patients and staff feel safer. In other words, working with us is a serious and exciting task – that's why we hire the very best and do our utmost to retain and strengthen them!
   

  

**At Ascom Sweden** 
 , we are a total of 240 colleagues, many of whom have extensive expertise and long-term employment, and are the most skilled in their field. Your career development through collaboration and training is important to us, and you will have opportunities to participate in global and local initiatives, and projects internally.
   

  

 We are now looking for a new colleague to join our Service & Operations team in the role of
 **System Engineer.** 
 You will be part of an ambitious team that works closely together to provide our customers with the best service and follow-up, both onsite and remote.
   

  

**In the role of System Engineer** 
 , we want to give you firsthand experience of what it's like to work with technology at the forefront of the healthcare sector, and how we make a difference and impact lives in the community. This role also has a high focus on working with Ascom’s personal safety solutions for customers in the security segment, such as prisons.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Participate in projects related to the establishment of new Ascom systems.
* Project/contract work, including commissioning and testing.
* Handling technical incidents of varying difficulty both onsite at the customer and via remote support.
* Troubleshoot and fix issues, both hardware (HW) and software (SW).
* Ensure high customer satisfaction with excellent follow-up, documentation, and report writing.
* Maintain good communication with the customer and a positive attitude.
* Manage systems based on critical communication and high security.
* Collaborate with other technicians and project managers in the team.
* Test and upgrade our customer solutions.
* Eventually participate in a 24/7 on-call schedule.
* Work within the security segment, including environments such as prisons.


**Requirements**
* The role is security-classified, which means you must undergo a security clearance and be approved to take on the role.
* B-class driver's license.
* Willingness to travel.


**Technical Experience And Skills**
* Technical Engineering: Mid-level (Practical education)
* Application Engineering: Mid-level (Practical education)
* H&S: Certified according to local regulations and Basic H&S awareness
* An engineering approach with connotations of precision, predictability, measurement, risk mitigation, and professionalism
* 5+ years’ experience in a technical System Engineering position or similar
* Experience with digital tools, good system understanding and experience with network hardware such as switches, routers, etc.
* Experience working in projects and customer service.
* Experience with the Windows platform (installation, configuration, setup, and operation).
* Knowledge of telecommunications and networking, including TCP/IP and SIP.
* Understanding and interest in GSM, 4G, Wi-Fi is beneficial but not required.
* Experience in the healthcare sector is an advantage.


**Personal Qualities**
* Strong customer service skills and ability to write reports well.
* Analytical, structured, and quality-conscious.
* A team player, but also independent with the ability to plan your own workday and meet deadlines.
* Quick learner, with an affinity and interest in technical and IT-related subjects.
* Fluent in Swedish and good English skills, both written and spoken.


**We Offer**
* The opportunity to influence and contribute to Ascom’s development
* A varied and rewarding workday that keeps you engaged and learning
* Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home


 Are you interested in becoming part of the team? We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Want to learn more about us? Read on here: www.ascom.com
   

  

*Ascom is an employer that promotes diversity, equality, and inclusion. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status. We believe that a diverse workforce strengthens our team, drives innovation, and enriches our workplace. Join us in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is valued and has equal opportunities to succeed.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Role:**
* Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
* Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
* Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Work close to the Product Owner and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
* Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
* Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies


****Essential requirements:****
* Passion for Data, people, and technology
* At least 4+ year’s work experience including hands-on as Data engineer on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Experience in GCP tools – Dataflow and Bigquery
* Experience in Data Build Tool (DBT)
* Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala.
* Good understanding of different data modelling techniques and trade-off
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
* Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
* Experience in working with data visualization tools
* Fluent in English both written and verbal


**Meritorious:**
* Business understanding of retail industry


**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** 
**when applying.**
**Utilization** 
**:** 
 100
 **%**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 04-08-2025-31-01-2025
   

  

**Last day to apply** 
 : 28-07-2025
   

  

 We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Fullstackutvecklare till IT-avdelning
description:
**Vill du utveckla samhällsnyttiga system i teknikens framkant och bidra till en modern offentlig sektor? Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare med erfarenhet av Java och JavaScript som vill arbeta i ett seniort agilt team med ansvar för både nyutveckling och förvaltning. Tillsammans får vi Sverige i arbete. Vill du bli en av oss?**
**Avdelningens uppdrag**
 Vi på avdelningen Myndighetsgemensam IT har det övergripande ansvaret för digitala stödsystem för myndigheten. Vi arbetar agilt och i nära samarbete med verksamheten för att skapa smarta och effektiva lösningar som stöder myndighetens mål om en mer digital och effektiv arbetsprocess. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och forma framtidens arbetssätt inom offentlig sektor. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor, goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och en chans att göra verklig skillnad.
   

  

 Under de senaste åren har Arbetsförmedlingen investerat kraftigt i nya tekniska plattformar, bland annat AI, Openshift, datasjön, Lagringsplattform med flera.
   

  

**Vem söker vi**
 Vi söker dig som vill vara med på resan att skapa moderna IT-lösningar, genom att vara en del i ett agilt seniort utvecklingsteam som stödjer Arbetsförmedlingens arbete med att hantera myndighetsinformation och regelverk genom till exempel E-arkiv och Diarieföringssystem.
   

  

 Anställningen är på IT-avdelningen och utvecklingen sker i nära samarbete med sakkunniga från olika delar av verksamheten, exempelvis Rättsavdelningen. Rollen innefattar arbete med utveckling och förvaltning av befintliga stödsystem för verksamheten, men även framtagning av nya lösningar genom tillämpning av Arbetsförmedlingens plattformar.
   

  

 Som fullstackutvecklare behöver du vara en agil teamspelare och ha full kontroll på allt ifrån utveckling, test, support, vidareutveckling, drift och förvaltning, till ansvar för kodkvalitet och driftsdokumentation. Att snabbt kunna anpassa sig efter förändrade förutsättningar och att vara flexibel är grundläggande för att lyckas i rollen. Du behöver därför vara nyfiken, ansvarstagande och ha en stark drivkraft att arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Som anställd på Arbetsförmedlingen har du också tillgång till kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom myndigheten. Genom vårt arbete bidrar vi till ett inkluderande och hållbart samhälle, där du får möjlighet att göra en verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort. Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten**
* Högskole-/universitetsutbildning med IT-inriktning motsvarande systemvetare eller civilingenjör, alternativt erfarenheter som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdiga.
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
* Minst 3 månaders erfarenhet av utveckling med JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska, både i tal och skrift


**Övriga meriter för tjänsten**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Enterprise Content Management plattformar
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en komplex IT-miljö med många IT-system
* Erfarenhet av arbete med OpenShift
* Erfarenhet av Angular
* Erfarenhet av Devops


 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet. Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast
 **2025-08-11** 
 .
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
   

  

**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.**
 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: Af-2025/0062 2412 | Kontakt: Mahad Malingur, Sektionschef mahad.malingur@arbetsformedlingen.se, Eliza Chmurzynska, Rekryteringspartner eliza.chmurzynska@arbetsformedlingen.se, | Facklig företrädare: Carin Carlberg Berglund, ST 010-4876223, Andreas Deniz, SACO 010-4862198, Ulf Törnkvist, SEKO 010-4870446, | Publicerat: 2025-07-07 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-11

title: Chief Product & Technology Officer (CPTO)
description:
**About Nofence** 




 Nofence is a pioneering Norwegian scale-up backed by prominent Norwegian and international investors. We are at the forefront of modern agricultural technology, with a mission to revolutionize livestock management. Nofence has developed a cutting-edge virtual fencing system that uses advanced GPS technology and intelligent collars to replace traditional physical barriers.
 



  





 We are a customer-centric, product-led organization. Understanding our customers’ needs better than anyone else is our winning recipe. Our mission goes beyond technology — we’re creating meaningful solutions that contribute to sustainable agriculture, while fostering a company culture where talented professionals can make a real difference.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As CPTO, you’ll lead both product and engineering, shaping our long-term strategy and transforming our hardware and rich agricultural data into scalable software products. You’ll be responsible for building a high-performing, customer-obsessed organization, ensuring we achieve strong product-market fit and deliver measurable impact.
 



  





 This is a rare opportunity to drive the evolution of agricultural technology on a global scale, combining advanced hardware, intelligent software, and a mission-driven team to tackle the environmental challenges of tomorrow.
 



  





 We’re still at the beginning of our journey. The opportunity space is vast, offering room for innovation and improvement across every aspect of our platform and customer experience.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Building on our product-led foundation to continuously strengthen product-market fit
* Mentor and develop technology and product leaders while building high-performing, cross-functional teams
* Oversee our technology stack — from the animal-wearable hardware in the field to real-time data processing, user-facing mobile apps, and cloud infrastructure
* Advance innovation in machine learning applications for agricultural insights
* Lead long-term innovation and R&D efforts to ensure sustained product differentiation and future growth
* Drive our data strategy to unlock insights from livestock behavior patterns, environmental conditions, and farm operations
* Champion our environmental impact measurement and reporting, using technology to demonstrate quantifiable sustainability benefits to customers and stakeholders



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proven experience as a CTO, VP of Engineering, or similar senior technology leadership role
* Strong background working in product-led, cross-functional, growth companies that have scaled internationally
* Experience building and scaling technology teams and engineering organizations
* Proven ability to establish a data-driven decision-making culture and product analytics frameworks
* Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, including customers, partners, and investors.
* You have a hands-on engineering background, with experience ’in the trenches’ as a software engineer
* HW experience is a plus, especially for candidates with a primary background in SW or SaaS



  





**Personal Characteristics** 



* Entrepreneurial mindset with strong business acumen
* Pragmatic, down-to-earth leader focused on results
* High energy and comfortable leading multifaceted projects
* Team player with high work ethic and attention to detail
* Experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders internally and externally



  





 We’re seeking a leader who shares our passion for building meaningful technology and driving sustainable impact. If you’re ready to lead the next phase of innovation in agricultural technology and create something truly impactful, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





 Nofence HQ is based in Oslo, but we're flexible with the work location (preferably within the Nordics), as long as you're willing to travel regularly and stay closely connected with the team.
 



  





*This search is being conducted in partnership with our recruitment partners at Safemind Executive.*

title: Business Analyst, Performance Analytics
description:
Are you an analyst with passion for data, analytics an eye for visualization and communication? Do you believe that with the right data you can change people and companies? Join us on our journey to promote situational awareness by empowering our sales and service teams with actionable and decisive insights.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are strengthening our analysis team with a Business Analyst within Performance Analytics, to develop and enable data driven and customer centric strategic decisions through end-user friendly reports. To do this you will work closely with stakeholders to develop powerful KPI:s and steering components utilizing modern databases and analytics.
   

  

 As Performance Analyst in Consumer Solutions you will always have your end-users in mind, making data and insights truly useful by combining analytics, communication and visualization skills. You are not afraid to apply novel techniques or methods where it needs and your curiosity drives you constantly forward.
   

  

 With a high degree of autonomy, you are confident in your capabilities in stakeholder management and collaboration to identify new areas for support and improvement across a Nordic organisation. Ideal candidates have a few years of relevant experience, excel in a landscape between data engineers and business and with an analytical mindset and experience of working with Microsoft PowerBi and SQL.
   

  

 The role will be part of a Nordic team of three people, and reports to Performance Analytics Manager. The sub-team is part or the Performance Analytics and Insights team of nine people. The position can be based at one of our Nordic Campuses in Norway, Sweden or Finland.
   

  

**Responsibility areas**
 As Business Analyst, Performance Analytics you will collaborate with any part of the Nordic Customers organization, including sales & service, payment & invoicing among many others to understands their business needs. You will To constantly improve our quality and availability of data, you will be the link between Nordic Customers Teams and the internal data team, supporting the development and maintenance of data pipelines with input on logic, harmonization, definitions and new data needs.
   

  

 You are tasked with both shorter and longer project in addition to ad-hoc tasks. You will strive for automating tasks when its possible. You will work both with developing KPI:s and data models on request but as well proactively. Your great autonomy and flexibility in creating the solution enables you to use tools you best believes supports the need, even if it’s more advanced such as machine learning.
   

  

 As the bridge between data engineers and business you will keep the end-users informed and educated of new models, KPI:s and reports. In addition, work closely with the rest of the analysts to ensure we are building best overall solution and share our best practices across areas. You will be responsible together with other analysts of the PowerBI app, maintaining access rights, automation and documentation.
   

  

**We offer you**
* A positive, international working environment where we aim high, built on expertise, ambition, and the urge to succeed.
* A hybrid work model and a holistic view on wellbeing, reflecting our commitment to supporting you, with care.
* A culture built on collaboration and shared success, because we win together.
* The opportunity to shape how we work with lead management as a strategic enabler for customer success.


**Qualifications**
* Higher relevant education, preferably in technology / economics / statistics, with emphasis on quantitative subjects.
* Proven experience in PowerBI including:
* Advanced knowledge of DAX and M -languages, and their pros and cons.
* Ability to work as a Power BI Service workspace admin and a champion who drives insight-driven culture forward.
* Experience with programming languages like SQL, Python, R and visualization tools like PowerBI is an advantage.
* Experience in working with a data warehouse or data lake utilizing Azure and Databricks or similar.
* Familiarity with machine learning concepts is a plus, but not required.
* Good written and verbal ability in English and any of the Nordic languages. Fortum’s working language is English.
* Work experience in relevant field, with proven track-record of creating business growth or improved collaboration through visualization of data.


 Personal qualifications: To succeed in this position, you need strong analytical skills and a data-driven approach to structured problem-solving. A commercial mindset, high drive, and target orientation are key, as well as being an effective communicator and relationship-builder. Being self-motivated and able to prioritize tasks effectively is crucial, along with attention to detail in your work. You are also curious and innovative with a focus on applying new technologies, automation of tasks and using hypothesis testing in your problem-solving approach.
   

  

**About Fortum Consumer Solutions**
 In Fortum Consumer Solutions, our Nordic Customers Business function delivers value to our customers through Smart, Modern, Advisory, Reliable, and Transparent service and sales tailored to their needs. Our scale and international approach enable ongoing investments in employee development, tools, and processes to uphold top-quality, reliable, and efficient standards. This ensures our customers receive world-class solutions and experiences, contributing to profitable and sustainable operations.
   

  

 In Consumer Solutions we are offering our 2.4 million customers reliable and sustainable energy, making their everyday lives easier with new technology and innovative solutions and services.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application by 13.07 at the latest. We screen candidates on an ongoing basis and we might call for interviews before the application deadline. If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Benjamin Hendler through e-mail benjamin.hendler@fortum.com.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Customer Technology Advisor- Cloud
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our dynamic team as a Customer Technology Advisor and become an integral part of our cutting-edge Go-To-Market team. As a certified expert in your field, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing technology solutions for our valued customers. Working hand in hand with our Kyndryl Consult Partners and customer partners, you will leverage your technical and solution expertise to drive targeted opportunities and exceed customer expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you won't just be another advisor; you will be a trusted ally and visionary, delivering unique and differentiated value to our customers. Through captivating show-and-tell methods such as engaging demos and compelling presentations, you will showcase our credibility and eminence in the industry, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.
   

  

 As a vital member of our team, you will support Consulting, Advisory, and Architecture activities across Sales, Pre-Sales & Delivery, collaborating closely with Customer Partners and Kyndryl Consult Partners. With your extensive technical knowledge and mastery of the practice-specific domain, you will bring together the breadth of Kyndryl's expertise to develop profitable deals that drive our success.
   

  

 Your dedication to continuous improvement and your passion for our practice will shine through as you showcase your end-to-end knowledge of the domain you align with, as well as the associated subdomains. Your technical prowess, backed by your external certifications, will establish you as a true authority in your field.
   

  

 As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will possess strong technical and business acumen, allowing you to provide value driven solutions within the practice services domain(s). Your exceptional customer facing skills, combined with your articulate communication style and interpersonal finesse, will enable you to effortlessly convey the technical benefits of Kyndryl's capabilities, perfectly matching the unique needs of each customer.
   

  

 As a strategic thinker, you will identify the intricate business and technical requirements of our customers, leveraging the vast capabilities of Kyndryl to generate winning cross-practice solutions. Your ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, and prototypes will clearly demonstrate the tangible value our offerings bring to our customers, leaving them eager to partner with us.
   

  

 In addition to your technical expertise, you will also take the lead in coordinating the entire pre-sales process, ensuring quality and compliance verification while adhering to Kyndryl best practices. Your collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will generate winning responses and create optimal technical solutions. Moreover, you will actively build and nurture relationships with our external alliance partners, fostering a collaborative environment where joint solutions are co-created.
   

  

 Join our team of forward thinking, tech-savvy professionals and embark on a journey of innovation, growth, and fulfillment. As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will not only shape the future of technology solutions but also make a meaningful impact on the success of our customers and Kyndryl as a whole.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Deep domain knowledge of Services offerings and technical solutions in the AMS Practice
* Demonstrated experience translating distinctive technical knowledge into actionable customer insights and solutions
* Prior consultative selling experience
* Externally recognized as an expert in the technology and/or solutioning areas, including technical certifications supporting subdomain focus areas including: Application Data and AI; Cloud; Core Enterprise and zCloud; Digital Workplace; Network and Edge; Security and Resiliency


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* 5 years of experience (minimum) selling technical services for multi-industry customers


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Data Engineer, Stockholm
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datadrivna beslutsstöd hos Sveriges största rådgivningsbyrå för småföretagare? Vi söker nu en erfaren och nyfiken Data Engineer!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Data Engineer kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i vårt arbete med att tillgängliggöra och strukturera data för analys, rapportering och beslutsstöd. Du arbetar nära controlling, IT och verksamheten – och får vara med och bygga vidare på vår moderna dataplattform i AWS (S3, AWS Glue, Redshift etc), hantera behörigheter via RLS (Row-Level Security) med mera. Rollen är både teknisk och affärsnära, och du blir en viktig kugge i ett team med stora ambitioner.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med data engineering, dataplattformar eller liknande roller.
* God kunskap inom Python, SQL och erfarenhet av molnbaserade lösningar – t.ex. AWS.
* Intresse för eller erfarenhet av ekonomi, redovisning eller affärsstöd – du behöver inte vara expert, men förståelse och nyfikenhet på affären är viktigt.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och samtidigt bidra till teamet med idéer och initiativ.


 Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med verktyg som Power BI, Glue eller Redshift – men vi är också öppna för dig som snabbt lär dig nya miljöer och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Varför Ludvig & Co?**
 Vi erbjuder en vardag där du får påverka, bygga nytt och göra skillnad – i ett team som arbetar nära ledning och verksamhet. Här kombinerar vi teknik, affärsförståelse och ett tydligt syfte: att hjälpa Sveriges småföretagare att växa. Hos oss finns också:
   

  

* Stor flexibilitet i hur du lägger upp ditt arbete och möjlighet att växa tekniskt och professionellt
* Friskvårdsbidrag (5000 kr)
* Tjänstepension enligt ITP
* Utfyllnad av föräldralön
* Fina lokaler på Kungsholmen och engagerade kollegor i hela landet
* Hybridarbete (två dagar per vecka i Stockholm)


 Låter det intressant? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

*Ludvig & Co samarbetar med Friday Vibes i denna rekrytering. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och därför vill vi be dig att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.*

title: Client Solutions Manager, Retail & Ecom - Global Business Solutions - Stockholm
description:
**Responsibilities**
 Client Solutions are the trusted advocates connecting key stakeholders, providing inspiration and insights, driving collaboration that translate into long term client partnerships and growth! We are responsible for the day to day relationship and for ensuring success of advertiser investment. As trusted partners, we proactively advise our clients of opportunity and solutions to exceed their expectations, securing future investment.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a highly skilled and motivated Client Solutions Manager to help scale our growing advertising business. The Client Solutions Manager is a key member of the Advertising Team, working with sales, product, and other business partners to analyse and improve advertisers’ performance on TikTok, in support of their marketing initiatives. They will work with our unique data and translate it into high-quality and actionable insights and recommendations to improve the effectiveness of advertiser campaigns and unlock business opportunities. Day to day, their activities include analysing metrics of success for businesses in the team, developing data-driven insights and recommendations, and communicating recommendations in a clear and compelling fashion.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

 - Lead lower-funnel media strategy, planning, and campaign execution to meet client business goals.
   

 - Manage and grow post-sale advertiser relationships through consultative business reviews and collaboration with sales.
   

 - Drive adoption of TikTok’s auction platform and tools, offering technical support and real-time performance analysis.
   

 - Support pre-sale efforts with research, pitch development, and cross-functional collaboration.
   

 - Educate internal and external stakeholders via training sessions, documentation, and whitepapers.
   

 - Define and oversee measurement strategies, including advanced solutions like Conversion Lift Studies, to generate actionable insights.
   

 - Analyze and optimize campaign performance, providing data-driven recommendations and platform feedback to product teams.
   

 - Present insights and performance results in a clear, consultative manner to drive client success.
   

 - Demonstrate deep analytical ability, and develop great expertise in TikTok’s proprietary metrics, working to constantly evolve how we analyse and communicate data driven insights to our advertisers
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Minimum Qualifications:
   

 - Demonstrated experience of account management/performance experience in digital marketing
   

 - Knowledge and understanding of tracking, attribution and measurement (Pixel, Events API (CAPI), MMM, MTA, MMP, SKAN etc)
   

 - Tangible experience executing on a biddable network
   

 - Experience managing brand advertisers with a deep understanding of their challenges across full funnel objectives
   

 - Ability to analyse data and identify insights to assess campaign performance
   

  

 Preferred Qualifications:
   

 - Results oriented with high attention to detail and strong organisational skills
   

 - Proactive attitude with excellent project management, organisational, and analytical skills
   

 - Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to effectively translate technical language to non-technical stakeholders
   

 - Experience diagnosing and solving technical problems with product and engineering teams
   

 - Experience using Excel or Google Sheets essential, familiarity with visualisation tools
   

 - Comfortable presenting complex analysis in a simple, easy to digest way to C-suite level stakeholders
   

  

**About TikTok**
 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​
   

  

  

**Why Join Us**
 Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​
   

 We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​
   

 ​
   

 Diversity & Inclusion​
   

 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.​

title: Analyst to Markets Trading
description:
**Job ID: 30212**
**Analyst to Securities Finance & Structured Products Sales, Markets Trading**
 Would you like to join the largest bank in the Nordics? Securities Finance & Structured Products Sales in Nordea Markets is offering a unique opportunity for a talented and ambitious Analyst to be part of the fast-paced trading floor at the leading Nordic investment bank. The job is based in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible, and is designed to kick-start your career within the Markets area.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 The Securities Finance & Structured Products Sales team is responsible for originating, structuring and executing market leading securities finance deals and structured products to a broad range of professional clients such as investment companies, hedge funds and family offices across the Nordics and beyond.
   

  

 In the role you will become an integral part of the team, gaining unparalleled exposure to Nordea’s trading floor through hands-on experience with complex financing structures, securities lending and various equity and credit derivative products. You will learn from and assist experienced colleagues, working closely with our clients to provide first-class capital market products. We offer an ambitious and innovative environment characterized by teamwork and trust, where your ideas and contribution will be valued from day one.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
 Main responsibilities in this role are to assist senior colleagues in day-to-day operations, support client relationships, help prepare client presentations, analyse market opportunities and help structure tailored financing solutions for professional clients across the Nordics. Over time, you will expand your knowledge of our structured, equity and credit derivative product offerings. You will proactively promote our products, identify new market opportunities and build a solid network to increase confidence and visibility in our offerings. Additionally, you will manage information flow and collaborate with stakeholders on projects and client engagements to build trust and confidence in our team’s capabilities.
   

  

* Support senior colleagues in day-to-day operational matters related to clients
* Analyse market opportunities, help structure deals and build client pitches
* Develop expertise in securities finance, equity/credit derivatives, and structured products
* Drive internal and external promotion of our products
* Collaborate and build relationships with stakeholders


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a curious and highly motivated problem solver with a genuine interest in financial markets and products with a high analytical capacity. We expect our new colleague to be self-driven and have an eagerness to learn.
   

  

**In addition, the successful candidate should fulfil the following criteria:**
* Graduating in 2025 or recently graduated with maximum two years’ work experience post-graduation from university
* Master’s degree within relevant field such as finance, economics or other technical degree with excellent academic credentials from a top-tier university
* Strong proficiency in Excel and other Microsoft Office applications
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**What We Offer**
**People** 
 come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 To apply, please submit your application including CV, cover letter and university transcripts as soon as possible. We will interview on a continuous basis and encourage early application, but apply no later than 31/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Sina Kazemi (sina.kazemi@nordea.com).
   

  

 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Marketing Manager - Nordics
description:
**Who we are:**
 For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.
   

  

 Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.
   

  

 We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.
   

  

**Your role:**
 The Marketing Manager - Nordics will play a critical role in developing and executing Global Relay’s marketing strategy in Sweden and across the Nordic region. The successful candidate will be responsible for building brand awareness, creating engaging content, and driving market entry initiatives.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be a native Swedish speaker, fluent in English, with a strong background in marketing, particularly in B2B, technology, and/or the financial services sector. We are looking for someone with a can-do attitude and a willing to roll up their sleeves: the Stockholm office is a new venture for Global Relay, and you will be instrumental in helping build its success.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Working closely with the global Marketing team, develop and execute a go-to-market strategy to establish Global Relay’s brand and product offering in the Nordics
* Plan and implement marketing campaigns to drive brand awareness, lead generation, and customer engagement
* Conduct market research to identify target market, sentiment, competitors, and opportunities in the region
* Assist in the ideation and management of internal events based out of our newly-opened Stockholm office
* Create compelling and localized marketing content, including blogs, case studies, and campaigns (in both Swedish and English)
* Understand Global Relay’s strategic and brand objectives and create a marketing plan to meet them
* Ensure all content aligns with Global Relay’s brand and resonates with the target audience
* Work collaboratively with the Nordics-based sales team to assist in the creation of execution of sales initiatives, where necessary
* Assist in the ideation and management of internal events based out of our newly opened Stockholm office


**About you:** 
  

  

  

* Demonstrable experience of building or to contributing to successful marketing campaigns
* An understanding of marketing strategy and the various mediums that inform such a strategy (digital marketing, content marketing, product marketing, etc)
* A good knowledge of Swedish/Nordic B2B practices, ideally in FinServ or new technologies as well as experience in developing brands to meet Nordic sentiment
* The ability to work collaboratively with a global team (on Zoom, IM, etc.) to see a project through from inception to fruition
* Excellent people skills and the experience to manage the expectations of key stakeholders of varying levels of seniority
* A willing to roll up their sleeves and get stuck in to with projects, particularly the running and management of events while the team grows
* A clear aptitude for organization and project management skills to assist with the running of marketing initiatives – from campaigns to events
* Experience in writing or creating content in various mediums, from emails to blogs
* Other useful experience includes:
+ Experience in using CMS systems (WordPress)
+ Demandbase
+ Content reporting tools (Google Analytics, Looker Studio)


**What you can expect:**
 At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.
   

  

 Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
   

  

 We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.
   

  

 We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.
   

  

 To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Product Specialist
description:
**Job Description:**
**Product Specialist**
**About Us**
 Easit AB is a Swedish software company with first-class consulting within system and business development. With in-house developed products for Enterprise Service Management and Data Management, we deliver powerful solutions to large companies and businesses for both the private and public sector. We’re situated in Sundsvall Stockholm, in Sweden, and have appr. 40 employees.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 The product specialist creates, develops and implements work processes in our product Easit GO. The role can involve both permanent assignments with customers or shorter and parallel assignments in project form. The role works close to the customer, works proactively, and is a catalyst for ideas. The position is placed in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**ROLE RESPONSIBILTILES**
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain long-term customer relationships
* Pay attention to customer needs and come up with solutions
* Configuration / adaptations in Easit GO
* Capture the customer's exact requirements in depth
* To run, facilitate and participate in workshops to find solution proposals for the customer
* Educate customers in the product Easit GO.


**Key Skills & Experience:**
* Proven previous experience as Product Specialist or similar
* Hold a degree or relevant qualification is desirable
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills, both in Swedish and in English
* Good understanding of technology and how it is applied in business
* A genuine IT interest
* Knowledge and experience within Microsoft programs, e.g.AD, Excel, Power BI and Azure
* Experience of working in processes
* ITIL certification is meritorious.


**Personal Attributes:**
* High degree of self-motivation
* Driven, High Energy and enthusiasm
* Honesty and integrity
* Strong customer service mindset
* Enjoys working in a team
* Be able to work independently.


**WHY JONAS SOFTWARE?**
* Be part of a dynamic and innovative global organisation.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.
* Opportunities for career growth within our expansive portfolio.
* Join a collaborative environment that champions diversity, equity, and inclusion, creating a space where everyone can excel.


**What Our Employees Say About Us**
 See what our employees say about us in the highlights video from our Jonas Annual Business Awards 2023 https://www.jonassoftware.co.uk/insights and our ‘Every Person Matters’ video from our Jonas Annual Business Awards 2024 https://www.jonassoftware.co.uk/why-jonas/people-culture/
   

  

**Additional Information**
**LOCATION**
* Remote or Office/Hybrid (ability to travel, sometimes at short notice)
* The position is based in Solna, Sweden.


**Benefits**
* Private Health Insurance
* Health Benefit 5 000 SEK yearly
* Contribution to you home internet connection.
* Mobile phone with 15 GB internet connection and free calls.


**MUCH MORE THAN A BENEFIT**
* Internal Learning & Development programmes
* Internal Mentor programme
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and Mental Health First Aiders to support you
* Jonas Europe & Jonas Global networking events (JABAs, GROW, JSA). Join communities, build networks and collaborate with your colleagues across the Global Group.


**OUR DEIB COMMITMENT**
 Our people define us and, at Jonas, we believe that diversity in all its forms enriches our organisation and drives innovation. We actively seek to create an environment where all employees feel valued, heard, and empowered to contribute their best work. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all. Come and be part of a team where your unique background and experiences are celebrated!
   

  

 We strongly encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, including those from underrepresented groups such as women, ethnic minorities, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ individuals and we are committed to creating an interview and hiring process that is accessible and inclusive for everyone.
   

  

**FLEX WORKS CULTURE**
 Here at Jonas Software UK & Europe, we see flexibility as a game-changer. We truly believe that working flexibly together helps to increase our innovation, growth and productivity, as well as supports our employees’ wellbeing and helps to provide great places to work.
   

  

 For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: working location, number of hours/days worked, different start and finishing times, flexible lunch break arrangements, agreed core hours, flexible hours, an element of working from home.
   

  

 Many of our employees work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want, but we do promise not to judge you for asking.
   

  

**Business Unit:**
 Easit ESM
   

  

**Scheduled Weekly Hours:**
 40
   

  

**Number of Openings Available:**
 1
   

  

**Worker Type:**
 Regular
   

  

**Career Site:**
**More About Jonas Software:**
 Jonas Software is the leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to the Country and Golf Clubs, Foodservice, Construction, Fitness & Sports, Attractions, Salon & Spa, Education, Radiology/Laboratory Information Systems, and Product Licensing industries. Within these vertical markets, Jonas is made up of over 65 distinct brands, which are respected and leaders within their own domain.
   

  

 Jonas’ vision is to be the branded global leader across the aforementioned vertical markets and to be recognized by customers and respective industry stakeholders as the trusted provider of ‘Software for Life’ and as an ambassador for technology, product innovation, quality, and customer service.
   

  

 Jonas Software is the valued technology partner of over 60,000 customers worldwide in more than 30 countries. Jonas employs over 2,000 skilled individuals consisting of a cross-section of industry experts and technology professionals. Jonas is headquartered in Canada and also operates offices throughout North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Australia New Zealand and Africa. Jonas is a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., headquartered in Toronto and traded on the S&P/TSX 60.
   

  

**IS THIS YOU?**

title: TikTok Creator – Spain
description:
**Location:** 
 Remote (Spain-based or with deep knowledge of the Spanish market)
   

  

**Type:** 
 Freelance / Part-time / Full time
   

  

**Start:** 
 ASAP
   

  

 Are you the kind of person who thinks in TikToks? Do you know exactly what’s trending in Spain before it hits the mainstream?
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Spanish-speaking TikTok Creator** 
 to help grow our brand in Spain with bold, creative, and culturally relevant content. If you know how to make content that entertains, connects, and spreads – we want you on our team.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Create original, trend-driven TikTok content tailored for Spanish audiences
* Stay plugged into TikTok trends, sounds, memes, and cultural moments in Spain
* Plan, film, edit, and publish videos that align with our brand voice
* React quickly to trending topics and viral formats
* Analyze video performance and refine strategy over time
* Collaborate with the social media and content team


**What We’re Looking For**
* Native-level Spanish speaker (English fluency is a plus)
* Strong knowledge of Spanish TikTok culture, humor, and Gen Z trends
* Video editing skills using CapCut, InShot, Premiere, or similar tools
* Comfortable being in front of the camera and bringing energy to content
* Highly creative, self-motivated, and quick to act on trends
* Bonus: background in entertainment, fashion, humor, or lifestyle content


**Why join us?**
* Creative freedom and space to experiment
* Fully remote and flexible working hours
* Work with a fast-growing international brand
* A team that values fun, originality, and bold ideas
* Real opportunity to grow as the brand expands in Spain


**Interested?**
 Send us your
 **TikTok handle** 
 ,
 **portfolio** 
 , or a few content examples. Add a short note about why you’re a great fit for our Spanish audience.

title: Systemförvaltare
description:
Vill du göra riktig skillnad varje dag? På Ragn-Sells är det exakt det vi gör, oavsett vilken position du har. Vi är ett familjeföretag i tredje generationen med erfarenheten i ryggen och blicken mot morgondagens innovationer. Hos oss får du vara med och forma en cirkulär framtid där vi minskar behovet av att bryta nya råvaror och istället använder det vi redan har – om och om igen.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Systemförvaltare till vårt team som består av 12 förvaltare. Vi hanterar förvaltningsobjekt inom hela Ragn-Sells koncernen och drivs alla av Ragn-Sells värdeord, vi tror på enkla lösningar, är ansvarstagande och har en framåtanda och helhetssyn på organisationen.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Arbete inom en av Sveriges viktigaste branscher
* En trevlig naturnära arbetsplats med bra och kompetenta kollegor
* Goda anställningsvillkor med 30 dagar semester och möjlighet till flextid samt kollektivavtal, pension och friskvårdsbidrag m.m.
* Kompetensutvecklingsmöjligheter genom vår egen akademi


**Ansvar och arbetsuppgifter**
 Som systemförvaltare hos Ragn-Sells arbetar du med att utifrån ett IT-perspektiv samordna och driva förvaltningen av ett eller flera affärsobjekt som i sin tur innehåller ett eller flera system eller moduler. I tätt samarbete med affärens motpart i förvaltningen ser vi till att säkerställa utveckling av systemstöd i enlighet med företagets affärskrav och vår IT-strategi.
   

  

 En central del av rollen är att ansvara för konfiguration, utveckling och förvaltning av vår SharePoint-miljö. Du implementerar bästa praxis för att säkerställa en effektiv och användarvänlig plattform för Ragn-Sells koncern, samarbetar nära team inom verksamheten för att säkra ett enkelt och effektivt arbetssätt i Microsoft Teams och andra Microsoft 365-tjänster. Du har också kontakt med vår support- och driftsorganisation för att säkerställa en stabil användarsupport och löpande förvaltning.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har avslutad eftergymnasial utbildning, gärna inom IT/teknik, eller motsvarande erfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig. Du har erfarenhet av systemförvaltning, gärna i enlighet med PM3, och en djup förståelse för SharePoint-funktionalitet och arkitektur.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa Microsoft 365-miljöer och har god kunskap om Teams och dess integration med övriga tjänster. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av ledningssystem är det meriterande. Certifieringar såsom Microsoft Certified: SharePoint Administrator är ett plus, men inget krav.
   

  

 Eftersom arbetet är både varierande och utmanande behöver du ha en god förmåga att anpassa dig till nya uppgifter och arbetssätt. Du kommunicerar tydligt och professionellt på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontakt**
 Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Personligt brev är inget krav för att söka tjänsten, besvara däremot gärna urvalsfrågorna så gott du kan. Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av Head of IT Maintenance Andreas Lundström på andreas.lundstrom@ragnsells.com,
   

  

 Ragn-Sells är ett av Sveriges främsta kompetensföretag inom återvinning och miljö. Vi samlar in, behandlar och återvinner avfall och restprodukter från näringsliv, organisationer och hushåll över hela Sverige. Våra erfarna och professionella medarbetare tror på enkla lösningar, ansvarstagande, helhetssyn och framåtanda. Vi är drygt 1600 medarbetare i Sverige. Ragn-Sells koncernen finns dessutom i Norge, Danmark och Estland.

title: Customer Technology Advisor - Application Services (Nordics)
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our dynamic team as a Customer Technology Advisor and become an integral part of our cutting-edge Go-To-Market team. As a certified expert in your field, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing technology solutions for our valued customers. Working hand in hand with our Kyndryl Consult Partners and customer partners, you will leverage your technical and solution expertise to drive targeted opportunities and exceed customer expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you won't just be another advisor; you will be a trusted ally and visionary, delivering unique and differentiated value to our customers. Through captivating show-and-tell methods such as engaging demos and compelling presentations, you will showcase our credibility and eminence in the industry, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.
   

  

 As a vital member of our team, you will support Consulting, Advisory, and Architecture activities across Sales, Pre-Sales & Delivery, collaborating closely with Customer Partners and Kyndryl Consult Partners. With your extensive technical knowledge and mastery of the practice-specific domain, you will bring together the breadth of Kyndryl's expertise to develop profitable deals that drive our success.
   

  

 Your dedication to continuous improvement and your passion for our practice will shine through as you showcase your end-to-end knowledge of the domain you align with, as well as the associated subdomains. Your technical prowess, backed by your external certifications, will establish you as a true authority in your field.
   

  

 As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will possess strong technical and business acumen, allowing you to provide value driven solutions within the practice services domain(s). Your exceptional customer facing skills, combined with your articulate communication style and interpersonal finesse, will enable you to effortlessly convey the technical benefits of Kyndryl's capabilities, perfectly matching the unique needs of each customer.
   

  

 As a strategic thinker, you will identify the intricate business and technical requirements of our customers, leveraging the vast capabilities of Kyndryl to generate winning cross-practice solutions. Your ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, and prototypes will clearly demonstrate the tangible value our offerings bring to our customers, leaving them eager to partner with us.
   

  

 In addition to your technical expertise, you will also take the lead in coordinating the entire pre-sales process, ensuring quality and compliance verification while adhering to Kyndryl best practices. Your collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will generate winning responses and create optimal technical solutions. Moreover, you will actively build and nurture relationships with our external alliance partners, fostering a collaborative environment where joint solutions are co-created.
   

  

 Join our team of forward thinking, tech-savvy professionals and embark on a journey of innovation, growth, and fulfillment. As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will not only shape the future of technology solutions but also make a meaningful impact on the success of our customers and Kyndryl as a whole.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Deep domain knowledge of Services offerings and technical solutions in a practice
* Demonstrated experience translating distinctive technical knowledge into actionable customer insights and solutions
* Prior consultative selling experience
* Externally recognized as an expert in the technology and/or solutioning areas, including technical certifications supporting subdomain focus area(s) including: Application Data and AI; Cloud; Core Enterprise and zCloud; Digital Workplace; Network and Edge; Security and Resiliency


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* 5 years of experience (minimum) selling technical services for multi-industry customers


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Recruitment Business Partner - Assortment & Creatives
description:
**Company Description**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US**
 Are you an experienced Recruiter who loves Fashion and has experience recruiting across creative and design roles? We have a unique opportunity at H&M for a Recruitment Expert to join our Assortment and Creatives Recruitment team. You will work in a small recruitment team and be responsible for hiring Fashion Designers across our various customer groups. A creative mind and eye for design are crucial as you will be required to review design portfolios, lead design interviews and liaise with our experienced Assortment Managers on a daily basis. It is key that you are able to spot a great designer through various interview stages.
   

  

 Exciting developments are taking place at H&M as we transition from a Retailer to a global Fashion Brand. Our recruitment team work in a very proactive, forward-thinking way and as we continue to shape the future of our business we need experienced Recruiters who are able to think out of the box to come on this journey with us. Our vision is to create a dynamic, strategic team that will serve as trusted advisors, driving talent and performance across the organization.
   

  

**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As Recruitment Business Partner for our Fashion and Creative area, you will own the full recruitment life-cycle, ensuring high-quality execution and expertise in every step. You’ll work closely with our Hiring managers and People Business Partners as a strategic advisor to guide hiring decisions in areas like Fashion Design, Product Development, Pattern Making and Buying.
